I took some pictures at a party and they came out great and have since used it for many other pictures and it always gives me good quality but of course if youre too shaky it will come out a little blurry.Now the picture quality in water....I noticed some reviews on here said it had bad quality underwater.  Well, I took this camera to a water park and held it in place while I was going down water slide and recorded videos of it, then I took it to the wavepool and took pictures under the water and videos of me and my friends swimming, and I say that the quality's great, I was quite impressed, I had everyone looking at me with envy at this camera (or maybe they just thought we were weird lol).  It also comes with a little strap to but around your wrist so you wont drop it or lose it while your doing things like what I was doing haha.So this 12 megapixel, 5x optical zoom underwater camera works great in my opinion, Id recommend it to anyone.  Also I work at Kmart where we sell these cameras and I sell quite a few bc I talk some customers into buying this one by telling them of my own personal experience, and I havnt had anyone return it yet, so Id say they must feel the same way i do about it.  So if your on the fence about it, give it a try, your friends will be jealous, or at least my friends were.

Reviews.Title: White water rafting - worked well
Reviews.Author: Gadget fan
Reviews.Content: I needed compact camera for our latest trip, since i cannt risk my DSLR near water. All the pictures were taken outside with enough light and it came out really well. It went into water twice but i dont see damage. As other customer mentioned keep checking any droplets on the lens. We had couple of pictures with droplets and lens flare which is not pretty. It may not be primary camera, but certainly backup camera for going near waterMy 4 year old can easily operate it. She loves to play with this toy.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: BigRay
Reviews.Content: Got this Camera as a spair to take on our cruise , It takes very good pictures and it is so nice to be able to take the Camera in the water with you ! It's Great !!!

Reviews.Title: it's the bomb
Reviews.Author: Kristina Erekson "kce"
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera for its waterproof features and name recognition.  I was heading to Cozumel, Mexico on a vacation with my younger brother and sister.Since it was their first time in Cozumel snorkeling, I let my brother to try it out and it was incredibly difficult for me to get it back.  He called it the bomb.When I finally got it back the camera was so easy to use and all the pictures I've taken so far have been of the highest quality.  I take it everywhere.I definitely would recommend this for anyone.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Very happy overall
Reviews.Author: LovinTakinPictures
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera before my son's pool party for his birthday. It was at an indoor pool, so I wasn't sure of how the quality would end up being, but I was very pleased. When the flash would go off, sometimes all I would get are pictures of bubbles (when someone was jumping in the pool), but if the subjects were still while underwater (generally), the pictures were GREAT! We did video (which took a little getting used to - you hit the video button and it starts recording then, you hit it again to stop - no shutter button is involved!) and it was great, too - with the exception of hearing the zoom in the video. The shutter is a little slow - which other people have mentioned - but it really does take awesome outdoor pictures. The indoor pictures are difficult to get in general, but I have used my old camera for indoor things. I specifically got this camera for outdoor use, especially in the pool. I am very happy overall with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for active families!
Reviews.Author: S. Taylor "hibiscusgirl"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera before heading to Florida last summer.  I love it!!  I wanted to take photos underwater and near the water without worrying.  The color and styling of the camera is great as well as its ease of use.  The only drawback I have found is that it doesn't zoom in that well from far away, but for relatively close action shots it is the best!! Fits in a pocket or small purse and you are ready to go!!! I highly recommend this camera!!!

Reviews.Title: no problems
Reviews.Author: Nancy MacKay
Reviews.Content: I returned this.  My own fault, I'm sure.  I thought it was an underwater camera.  Its a waterproof camera but you can't take it to any depth.  More like you can take it to the beach and get it went but certainly no diving with it.

Reviews.Title: Performed Great in Water!
Reviews.Author: Bennett Lovejoy
Reviews.Content: Was supprised at the performance of the camera in water.  Over all the camera took great pictures!  However, being an amatuer photographer many of our photos looked amatuer, which could have been improved if the camera had a quicker auto focus.  However, for the price and its durablitiy, underwater capability, this was a great purchase!

Reviews.Title: Only lasted 10 days of a 15 day trip to the Galapagos
Reviews.Author: Morning Star Holmes "Morningstar"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality was decent but after just a week the buttons got hard to use.  After 10 days the camera stopped working.  Too bad because we got some decent shots for the first week.  I don't recommend it if you are planning a once in a lifetime trip.

Reviews.Title: Fuji xp10 review
Reviews.Author: Scott Bishop "Online Surf Shop"
Reviews.Content: The Fuji xp10 is an excellent waterproof camera to take out surfing. This xp10 will take a pounding in grindy shore break and give you great quality surfer shots or surf videos. Very easy to use. You can shoot still shots and quickly switch over to video because the xp10 has its own dedicated button near your thumb. Fits the Surf Camera case nicely for surfing with! Check out our waterproof camera review site at [...]

Reviews.Title: Great Waterproof Camera at a Great price
Reviews.Author: D. Fong "derekinla"
Reviews.Content: For $120, this camera is a steal for what it does. I used this camera on a recent vacation to the western caribbean where I put it to use snorkeling in Playa Del Carmen and Grand Cayman Islands. The compact size makes it easy to carry around in your pocket. It worked flawlessly underwater and the picture quality was very good. Being able to take HD video is also a bonus! My only critique is that it is a little slow to power-up, navigating the menus, or reviewing pictures (compared to say my Canon SD780). Picture quality is also a small tick below my Canon SD780 but this is a trivial difference. Picture quality is really very good. For about $120, you can't beat this little gem. Bottom line: This waterproof camera is a great value and perfect for use on vacations when things get wet or little rough.... If you plan on going snorkeling, I recommend you get a floating wrist strap for about $5.....

Reviews.Title: great memoeies
Reviews.Author: happy traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. I took it to the carribean and came back with wonderfull picturs.  It is not slr quality but excellent for it intentions.  nice size to carry with you.  pictures were great in and out if water.  video quality is also great.  My only suggestion it to learn the setting before taking it on a trip.

Reviews.Title: Good Action Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Breeze111
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for picture taking on vacation while on the beach, in the beach, or jumping from waterfalls. The camera does all that well. Sand, dust, snow, or steam do not damage the camera. In terms of durability it is a 5 star camera. I jumped off a 40 foot cliff while taking video and the video was on until a couple seconds after impact, the shock made the video stop but the camera continued to work. I have captured amazing moments of water action that would have been impossible with a normal camera.All that stated, here is what this camera does NOT do so great, the shutter speed from when you click on the picture button to when the picture gets taken is somewhat slow. The picture quality is ok to good most of the time, sometimes there are excellent shots and sometimes the quality is not good (flash can be very bright with no way to adjust it). The lense is small so in terms of picture quality, it is a bit limited. For the price and what it is designed for, it is a fun camera. I am glad I own it. Other cameras in this category that are better are about $300, for the price, this camera delivers good value. I like that it has an easy to use video button for easy access to video when you need it. I have taken it to the snow and fell on it with my body weight and it still kept on ticking! I also like the action pouch it comes with. If you like action vacations or activities this a great inexpensive camera to capture cool moments and a camera that can handle a beating from drops, dust, sand, and water.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for active people
Reviews.Author: Guy in Houma "Guy in Houma"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo18G5ZIW5FFTGM', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo18G5ZIW5FFTGMloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo18G5ZIW5FFTGMpreplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo18G5ZIW5FFTGMpreplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81Mb%2BKGzHTS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } var node = cv_mo18G5ZIW5FFTGMpreplay.parentNode; var cv_mo18G5ZIW5FFTGMcurrentClick = node.onclick; node.onclick = function () { var head = document.getElementsByTagName("head"); if (head[0]) { var logTag = document.createElement('script'); logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo18G5ZIW5FFTGMcurrentClick) { return cv_mo18G5ZIW5FFTGMcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:01 MinsBought this camera for recent trip to Brazil. Easy to use, takes GREAT daytime photos and close night flash snapshots. Doesn't do well with night distance shots (skylines, etc). Bright daylight pictures are awesome. Camera is waterproof, I swam with it, walked in the rain, in and out of air conditioning and never fogged up. One nice feature is a clear piece of glass covers the lens assembly that's easily wiped clean with your t shirt. Also has a video record feature that works pretty good. Check out the fireworks video posted here, recorded with the FUJI XP10. Battery life is good, I charged it every other day or so. Charges in about 45 minutes. I accidently dropped it a couple of times, once on a ceramic tile floor, still works. Battle scar on the case, that's it.I experimented with all the different settings and settled on AUTO. Let the camera decide what to do. One thing I really liked is the delay between the time you press the button until it takes the picture is MUCH faster that previous cameras I've owned. You get the shot you want. Overall, for the money, it's a good deal.Pros: Small, fits in back pocket of blue jeans, fast power up, takes great daytime photos, waterproof, shockproof, decent video recorder, easy to use.Cons: Not too good in low light distance shots. Maybe all digital cameras are like this, I don't know. Close flash shots are great.Family alert: There is a reference to drinking in the video, the word 'drunk' is used.***** UPDATE ******July 2012After 18 months of loyal, durable and sometimes less than gentle use, it died. :(Don't know what happened, but on my 3rd trip to Jamaica with this camera, it quit. It didn't leak, good thing, the memory card was fine, pictures were there. It just quit. Not totally broken-hearted, she gave me great service for $125. I'm the guy that destroys cell phones in 4 - 6 months. Cell phone insurance carriers hate me.Rest well my dear camera-friend.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Angela L. Hall "Creative Shopping Mother"
Reviews.Content: Love that I can take it in the water with me and not purchase a separate "Water camera". Even did some video under water...cool! Only issue I have would be the zoom. Once I zoom in the camera seems to have trouble knowing what to focus on. I get a lot of blurry zoomed in photos, there is probably some troubleshooting for this, I just haven't figured it out yet. Also when taking video, you can hear the zoom when filming. Not a loud noise, but it is there. This is definitely a great buy otherwise. We are taking a trip to Disney soon and can't wait to use it in the water parks!!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price, durability is suspect, mfg support non-existent
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Chet Brewer"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my teen age daughter after she trashed her camera around water. She loves it and has taken a lot of good pictures with it. It survived several dunkings in the water and a couple of sailing trips. She wouldn't give it up for the world and gives me a look when I ask to borrow it. The accessory kit is really quite good also. Easy to use, rugged, and takes good pictures. What more can you ask for?8 month updateOk after 8 months it just up and stopped working. fuji warrenty service is non existent. This gets a major downgrade from 5 stars to 2. It is now a nice paperweight with no repair/warranty options that I can find anywhere. The fuji website is hopeless to navigate. I would suggest looking at another option for waterproof camera's

Reviews.Title: Poor Image Stabilization
Reviews.Author: A. Carter
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for 6 months and used it a lot. I find that it produces the most UN-stable photos of any camera I have ever used. I have a lot of blurry photos of subjects that were not even moving. It has good battery life, is waterproof and it sometimes takes great shots in challenging lighting conditions. But, I do not like the controls. It's hard to find and activate the ON/OFF button and the zoom toggle unless you are looking at them. For the most part, I am very dissatisfied and am trying to sell it.

Reviews.Title: fuji camera
Reviews.Author: shane
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 10 year old. So far, so good. She even tested it out in our bathtub and it still works. It has a lot of great features and options, more than I expected.  Appears to be a great value in my opinion as far as point and shoot camera go.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE WARRANTY REPAIR WONT FIX A THING!
Reviews.Author: C. Miller
Reviews.Content: Soooo...I was in the middle of writing an awesome review for this product since I had recently gotten it back from warranty repair and they "fixed" it for free. After about 4 months of use the cameras screen would have a bunch of green lines and render the camera useless so I sent it in. I got it back a few weeks ago from warranty repair and it came back working! ..until I just tried to use it to help write a good review. Well the problems back and even worse so I wasted $10 to send it in and get in returned to me so it would only work for 2 weeks.BEWARE it would be a good camera if it was well made and didn't break!UPDATE: SENT IT BACK TO WARRANTY REPAIR FOR A SECOND TIMEProblem not fixed and the letter i recieved back with the camera says "Claims display turns green, thoroughly inspected/cleaned. problem could not be duplicate"Yeah freaking right, a few days after getting it back from the second warranty repair it is having the same problem again. Seriously do not buy horrible warranty repair and crappy cameraFiled a claim with BBB, Fuji film is a joke!!!!DO NOT BUY DO NOT BUY DO NOT BUY!!!!

Reviews.Title: Niche p&s.;
Reviews.Author: Trebor "Trebor"
Reviews.Content: I've taken a few images with this little camera, and I would say that the images are a little soft, but easily improved in Photoshop or Picasa 3 which is a free.  I can't find the option to upload images (only video) so I can't show the sharpened images.The ergonomics are great, and it slips easily in a pocket or bathing suit.I wish the lens was a little faster like at least f/3.5 or better yet f/2.8.  The flash comes on in light that I consider sufficient.  That function can be turned off, but then the images are slightly blurry.  This camera requires more light to perform than I am used to on my G9 and D90.I think for the price ($145.00), it's a bargain; shockproof, waterproof and dust proof.  When I use it in water I tape a piece of electricians tape over the battery/memory card door as a precautionary measure.I'm glad I purchased this camera, it's a kick!Update; I thought the images were a little too soft, so I adjusted the picture quality from the default setting of normal to fine, and the difference is substantial, so I don't feel the need to do any sharpening in post processing.I also am finding that fill flash is necessary even in moderately low light, unless you are fond of blurry images.All in all, I'm quite pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof? Yes. Sandproof? HELL NO!
Reviews.Author: mbown334
Reviews.Content: I took this into the ocean body surfing no more then 3 times and each time afterwards I spent an hour picking the sand out with tweezers. Finally after the last time, sand got stuck in the shutter button and would let me take pictures. I got some really nice pictures with it before it broke! too bad.

Reviews.Title: good pictures and indestructable
Reviews.Author: Lauren "Lauren"
Reviews.Content: We were on a cruise doing a kayak excursion to climb Dunns River Falls and there two couples with this camera, we heard good things about it from them and were going snorkeling in Grand Cayman the next day so when we saw a stand on the ship selling cameras we bought it.  On the ship it came with a memory card, silicon skin, case, another wrist strap and a floating wrist strap (one of the couples dropped their camera in the water so that definitely came in handy), unfortunately we couldn't stop in Grand Cayman so it didn't get full usage but we used it in the pools and on a muddy ATV trip without worrying about ruining it.  It's a good camera for me, takes basic pictures and seems fairly indestructible, but pictures in low light turn out really spotty when they don't blur and it is hard to see the screen in sunlight.  When we're going I take our other camera, it takes much better pictures inside, but this one is great with outside pictures.  I haven't used it for videos so can't comment on that.  Overall I recommend this camera for use outdoors and if you need an indestructible camera.

Reviews.Title: My daughter uses it at the zoo
Reviews.Author: B. Cassel
Reviews.Content: She's been using it at Lowry Park Zoo to document manatees that are being rehabilitated. This camera has produced some of the best underwater photos I've ever seen. So far it has exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: This camera is a piece of junk...
Reviews.Author: relbeis
Reviews.Content: I've been using a Canon SD850 point and shoot for about 2 years now and it is absolutely fabulous, but I've always been nervous to take it out in the rain or near water (for example, in a kayak).  So I looked into waterproof cameras and ended up going with this one.  I didn't want to spend a lot of money since I only really planned on using it when water might be involved.  I've had the camera for 2 days and I'm ready to return it.  First off, I probably took about 100 sample pictures and the battery is already dead.  Second, not one of those 100 photos came out nicely.  Every single one was out of focus and the color was washed out.  I'm not even going to give this camera a chance in the water.  Besides, it will probably break anyway, according to the reviews!If you are interested in seeing the quality, I added a photo.  It's a close up of a red rose.  Check it out.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be WITHOUT this Camera!
Reviews.Author: LAR
Reviews.Content: I am a 35 mm girl - went to Key West, FL for vacation - the BEST shots and video! clear pictures under the water and above - great shots of my son snorkeling!  couldn't image beign without this camera EVER!

Reviews.Title: Okay camera, but quirky enough for me to return it
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use during a trip to Berlin, as I wanted something small and somewhat water resistant for me to carry during the marathon.As I have a Fujitsu SLR, it was easy enough to cycle through the menus because the software is the same. No real learning curve on camera use...It was small enough to carry with ease in my pocket while on the marathon/vacation.  Facial recognition worked well, and I liked the clear piece of glass over the shutter, very handy when taking pics in the rain. I liked the fact there were no exterior moving parts.I found a couple of things I did not like about the unit, though.  The pictures were quite soft and not nearly as clear as I had hoped.  I found myself taking three or four photos of the same thing in an attempt to get a better, more clear photo.  When comparing the pics I was taking with a friend who had a Samsung camera, I found his were way clearer.I also noted that when the unit was placed in "silent" mode, the flash was supressed, period.  The reason for this still confuses me, as I  prefer to take pics without the obligatory "snapshot sounds" but could not do so without losing the flash capability of the camera.I also noted that the gray finish on the body had started to wear off after a short 5 days of use on this trip.At the end of the day, I decided to return the camera and continue looking for a compact unit that produces better photos, and doesn't show wear so quickly.  It isn't a bad little unit, just not worth what I paid for it considering the shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: This camera rocks!!
Reviews.Author: R.Schmidt
Reviews.Content: Recently I received the Fijifilm XP digital camera as a gift.  I started using it immediately to capture beautiful sunsets, different scenery, and candid shots of family and friends.  Last week I took it with me on vacation to the Outer Banks, NC.  While at the Beach one day, I decided to take the camera out on the a in the ocean to get some pictures of the beach.  While on the raft, we were overturned by a wave and came crashing into the surf. My camera slipped off my wrist and was sucked back into the waves.  I was heartbroken, it was the last day of vacation and all my photos were lost!  By some miracle my brother found the camera stuck in a tide pool as the tide receeded.  I was extatic thinking ok well I am sure the camera is trashed, but hopefully the memory card is still intact.  To my complete awe not only was the memory card perfectly sealed in its water proof compartment, the camera still worked!  Perfectly!  I has some scratches and dings from being tossed around in the surf for an hour, but it still works like new!  I would recommend this camera to anyone!  It is easy to use, has all the features of the more expensive bulkier cameras, and is the toughest camera I have ever seen.  I am definately a Fujifilm customer from here on out!

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: PUNKER
Reviews.Content: THIS Camera is great, so far it does everything it says it will do, had it down about 20 feet in water, great pics, small compact, ideal for the dollars,

Reviews.Title: 2nd one broken again!
Reviews.Author: Wolf Mann
Reviews.Content: I will need to replace this camera for the third time. The water proofing is horrible. A major disappointment. Steer clear.

Reviews.Title: Just Perfect
Reviews.Author: BR
Reviews.Content: Perfect image, even under water!As good as my last Sony, but with lower weight and price.I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: great little point and shoot
Reviews.Author: L. J. Anderson "mama cash"
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this little camera. It is a great rugged little go anywhere type of camera. Already I have taken it camping, taken some wild shots of a double rainbow after an electrical storm and lots of action shots of my 3 year old boy. I wish i could've taken some under water shots in the Jemez Springs, but it is tolerant to everything except heat. This camera is not for the professional or for art photos, but I am very pleased for all of the bang you get for the buck!

Reviews.Title: Would buy again.
Reviews.Author: L. McCool
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. My daughter bought one and then I bought one also. It works great. I would also get the flotation strap Fujifilm XP10 Accessory Kit  for it. It floats with no problem.  When I sat on shore I would only get the kids backs, now I can go in the water and get their smiles. I've also had the kids throw it on the beach and it's sand proof.  I do blow off the lens after I come out of the water so the drops of water don't alter the still pics or video above water. I had some shots ruined this way, but also some interesting pics.  Video I have taken with this camera can be seen on youtube. [...]

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Some Poor Design Choices
Reviews.Author: Trushdtd
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great camera for the price.  It works great underwater, shoots HD video, and is fairly easy to use.  However after just a week of use on our honeymoon the Green paint started to flake off on the painted aluminum portion of the camera which makes it look pretty beat up even though it was bearly used.  Also the menu navigating buttons are somewhat difficult to use due to thier small size.  Overall great product I just wish they used better design/manufacturing in making the product.

Reviews.Title: Extremely portable, effective camera
Reviews.Author: Yossarian
Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm finePix XP10 is the 4th digital camera I've obtained through Amazon, and arguably my favorite (the first 3 were all Canon).  Encased in a sleek, tapered shell, the camera looks good, is lightweight, and fits neatly in one hand.  The video quality is not the highest, but we have no complaints about single images (including of activity).  There is a slight delay in shutter speed, particularly if the flash is used, but it becomes less of an issue as one gets more familiar with the camera.  That slight user issue is also offset by the easy portability of the camera itself.  While you may occasionally regret not having a faster camera if you are already engaged in a photo shoot, I like to carry my XP10 around in my shirt pocket all day just in case something noteworthy crops up.  In other words, it makes a great, light, utilitarian camera for sightseeing, hiking, or other activities where you may come across worthy photos as part of a larger experience, and don't want to lug a bigger more expensive camera around the whole time.The XP10 bills itself as highly resistant to water intrusion, dust, or other environmental factors.  I haven't taken it in a lake yet myself, but it has indeed held up well to rigorous outdoor activities.  It's nice to not have to worry about your camera if you happen to be caught in a brief rainstorm or the like -- you don't even need to scramble for a camera case.  All in all, I've found the XP10 to be a very useful digital camera that functions well in the woods as well as at high energy birthday parties for the kids.  My wife even found a way to change the menus to Thai (her favorite language), so it can be used by many folks for whom English may not be their first language.

Reviews.Title: Very good waterproof camera for the money
Reviews.Author: J. Wong "J Wong"
Reviews.Content: Before we got this camera, I read all of the reviews, including the problems people had with this camera.  We originally bought this camera for my daughter's pool party + Hawaii.  The picture quality was OK, and this has nothing to do with the camera, but the lighting of the water and how clear it is.  We used it again this weekend, and the light was really strong overhead and the pictures came out great!  So darn cute, and the quality and detail were amazing. The look on the kids' faces when I said "waterproof camera" was awesome.  My daughter, her friends, my husband had so much fun taking pictures and videos that day.IMO, for a waterproof camera, it does not have to be super expensive because it has to withstand salt water, chlorine, sand.  For me, with this kind of destruction, I did not want to spend a lot of money, but I also did not want it to break apart with the first use.  The port for the USB cable is actually in the same chamber as the SD card and battery.  We have opened it 5 times since we have had the camera this past June (2 months) and we have not experienced any of the problems as some people described where water seeped in because the seal was broken.For the money, it was a great buy and we still enjoy it and likely will for a long time to come.

Reviews.Title: great for outdoor water adventures
Reviews.Author: Sumulator
Reviews.Content: This camera does well in serving the function of being an outdoor waterproof camera. I went kayaking and snorkeling with the camera and took some great pictures. I can't wait to take this camera snowboarding with me. Only downside, camera battery doesn't last long, focus isn't too great for taking distant landscape pictures, image quality is average and there are no manual options for setting aperture, shutter speed, ISO, etc. However, you pay for what you get and I got this camera at Costco, came with a 4G Memory Card, camera strap, bag and batteries. This picture takes much better pictures than an underwater film camera. For the price and using this camera for the overall purpose of having an outdoor adventure of any sort, this camera has definitely been more than what I expected.

Reviews.Title: Definitely not right for everybody.
Reviews.Author: Don Marcos "Rhetor Marcus"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews for this product before buying it.  I am a Latin teacher and was about to travel to Rome and Pompeii, and I wanted the best possible pictures from an easy-to-handle camera. I liked the shockproof and waterproof features as well.Well, I think it is shockproof because it is so hard to move any part of it.  I regularly needed to press the power button 3 times to turn it on and often the shooting button twice to take a picture.  Or I needed to apply so much pressure that I moved the camera as I shot.  Other people had the same problems when I handed the camera to others to shoot me in the picture.I was often in museums or sensitive sites where flash photography was not allowed, so I set it for natural light.  Photos often resulted with glare where none was visible to the eye in the natural light.  How does that happen?Furthermore, it may simply have too many functions for me and other basic users. It was annoying to scroll through the many options.  And some did not work well together for no apparent reason.  For example, you can't change the sounds while using certain other settings.Finally, the battery never lasted the entire day.  I often had to rely on my Blackberry to get me through the day.I have returned this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix xp10
Reviews.Author: CLK_IDAHO
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer.  I just wanted a waterproof pocket camera to take to the streams with me or put in a pocket of my float tube.  Fits a pants packet just fine.  This camera is just what I was looking for and takes better pictures than I thought it would.  Battery life a little short so spare batteries are a must.  I definitely recommend this as a take hunting/fishing/hiking camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price but one major performance issue
Reviews.Author: Rockch1x
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera right before a two-week beach/cruise vacation. The camera takes really good pictures in low light and it performs well underwater.  The quality is good but not great for my underwater shots.  Even though it doesn't have HD video, the quality was good but the sound is not good.  I went snorkeling the whole week with this camera and never had a problem with leaks.  The battery does drain out if you don't turn it off after each shot.  I would leave it on at times while I was snorkeling so that I would have it ready when I wanted to snap a picture of a moray eel coming but found that I couldn't last a whole day with my battery.  The different modes were great and it ensured that I got good pictures.  As far as the camera body, the light green paint on the side where the model name was wore off completely within two days.  Maybe it had to do with the salt water.  Same thing with the plastic peeling off on the back of the control buttons.  My main pet peeve with this camera is that after about 3 days, after taking a picture; if I wanted to review, it would stick.  I would have to take the battery out for a few seconds and it would come back but sometimes it wouldn't.  Sometimes deleting the pictures would keep going if you don't stop it after 5 mins.  Seems like Fujifilm has some software issue that they need to work on.  This was my first experience with owning anything other than a Canon.  I've never experienced this with Canon ever.  I love the 5X optical zoom on this camera.  I wouldn't recommend this camera until they fix this software glitch.  The great thing about this camera is that you don't have to install any software at all.  Just plug the USB cable and you're set.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful underwater pictures
Reviews.Author: Mimi
Reviews.Content: This is my sports camera. We have used it at the beach,snorkeling,diving,water parks & at the springs. Good compact camera. Love the picture quality. Have lots of fun with the its versatility.UpdateLove this camera. Great for OUTDOORS use!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Small, Cheap, and Easy
Reviews.Author: L-Dogg
Reviews.Content: This camera hasn't let me down yet. I have a FujiFilm E900 that I use for my main camera and this is more like a backup. Its one hell of a backup though, I'm not afraid to throw this in my pocket and be on my way to car shows, concerts, the beach, or whatever else may pop up. The only small annoyance is that when shooting video, zooming in and out will cause a brief gear noise in your video as others have indicated. I say its a small annoyance because most times when I'm shooting video I only set the shot once anyways. Pictures generally come out in very respectable quality given the size/type of camera it is.Bottom Line: BUY IT if you are looking for a nice, cheap camera with high portability.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great...for a couple of weeks then it died.
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Kuehne
Reviews.Content: I did quite a bit of checking for a reasonably cheap underwater camera, knowing if it malfunctioned I would not be out of luck due to top quality service I've experienced in the past from Amazon. I didn't really find it cheaper on Ebay, plus on Ebay you get to deal with their crummy return services, it any at all. Good thing, after about 2 weeks the camera stopped working, and I just completed the online return forms on Amazon and will be dropping it off at a UPS shipper tomorrow morning for a refund.Pros:  Fun, easy to use, used it in pools and snorkeling in Hawaii. Picture quality is pretty good for a camera at this price. I didn't use the video functions so I can't comment on that. I does have a slow shutter speed, but once you get used to it no problem.Cons: Too good to be true, first the display went out, then it stopped functioning, thankfully it died towards the end of our trip. Disappointing, it took some fairly good underwater pictures of sharks, fish and my kids. Never took the camera more than about 2 feet under water. specs on the camera say up to 3 meters -  I never got anywhere close to that deep.Major CON: The design of the memory card slot and battery slot are in a rather poor position. It has  a sealed section for the battery and memory card, however once you start using it you will notice the little door is directly beneath the shutter button on the bottom of the camera. When I hold a camera this small my index finger is on top - shutter, and thumb grips the bottom - where the door is at, I noticed the little door sliding back and forth a little, never opening just slightly moving when taking land and water pictures.  I don't know if that's what killed the camera or not. It did die in the water though. The LCD went out, then it stopped taking pictures altogether.It was a great camera for a little while, maybe it was just my luck.Fujifilm FinePix XP10 12 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Green)

Reviews.Title: only as good as the focus
Reviews.Author: GBB454
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to replace the previous waterproof Fuji model. Like the styling of this P&S; camera but the reflective nature of the screen makes shooting in sunlight difficult, Focus is iffy at best in several settings. High speed sport setting and the night settings were exceptional. A more responsive autofocus woulld make this an exceptional buy. I will return and spend a little more for better focus performance.

Reviews.Title: Horrible low light performance and auto-focus
Reviews.Author: Jason Kuehn
Reviews.Content: Anyone giving this camera more than 2 stars has simply never owned a decent digital camera.  In bright light, outdoors, this camera can take a decent pic providing you get it to focus.  The autofocus is slow and often outright blurry.  I missed countless shots because of the auto-focus.  Anything indoor or low light is horrible.  I've seen better pics from disposables.I bought this for a vacation where I needed the waterproof feature and didn't want to risk taking my "old" f31fd.  That old fuji takes 10x better photos than this, especially in low light.  Now that I'm home I have found that at least 1/3 of my pics from vacation are out of focus or too dark.This would make an ok camera for a kid to play with due to its physical toughness and low cost, but it's horrible for a main unit if you know anything about photography.  I'm returning mine to the store.

Reviews.Title: A mixed bag, I would not recommend for your "main" camera
Reviews.Author: KindlePad
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a weekend resort getaway that has a great set of pools for the kids. I can never get good pool shots just walking around the side of the pool with my Sony so I thought I'd try a waterproof camera. I didn't want to spend too much $, and this new model seemed to be perfect.Pros:1. Decent price, affordable as a "second" camera to take to the pool or the beach.2. Acceptable day time shots, slightly better than I expected.3. Water proof shots, with enough light, are very nice. This was a pleasant surprise. I got some great underwater shots of the kids.4. HD video is great underwater! Video controls are very easy, a start and stop right on the camera back.5. Battery life seemed fine, I shot more than 100 shots a day and still had plenty of charge. Comes with a nice, compact battery charger.6. Small & compact, slides in your swim pants pocket easily and doesn't weigh much.Cons:1. The controls are very awkward to use, especially in or under water. Buttons and shutter placement should have been better thought out. I would think big, round, easy to find by touch buttons would be the way to go on a camera you are going to use under water. Not stylish, slippery, recessed little buttons. It takes some getting used to, at first I really disliked it.2. Focus problems - in 2010, even for a "budget" camera there should not be focus problems, especially in daylight. Also the camera had some problems focussing when shooting video. I had several clips & pics I had to delete as they were out of focus. Grrrr.3. The camera makes a very loud "whirrring" noise that can be heard if you use the zoom while recording. Basically, do NOT zoom while recording video or it'll sound like the Transformers are attacking.4. The "SR Auto" (auto scene recognition) was useless. There is an under water mode but even when I was under water the SR Auto could not detect it. You really need to manually change the scene settings to get the best shots. I am assuming many people might not ever figure this out as SR Auto is the default shooting mode.I am not sure if I am going to keep this camera. The focus problem is a real deal breaker, even for a budget camera. Still, its $150 for a 12mp, HD video water proof camera. It's hard to really fault it very much.

Reviews.Title: The Fujifilm XP 10 is Fantastic!!!
Reviews.Author: Mayelin Hazan
Reviews.Content: This camera is Awesome! I couldn't be any happier with this camera. It takes great pictures, works great underwater, the style of the camera is cool, the screen lets you view the pictures and the video clean and clear. It has great features and options for picture taking. I used this camera when I went to Raging Waters, got on the slides and pool with it and caught the moments I wanted to catch great. The video did take a couple of seconds longer to load than I expected so if you want to record something quickly it might be best to put the camera on video mode about a minute or so a head of time, also I had to buy the memory card seperate )-: wished it came in the package, but other than that it really is an awesome camera. Great buy. Very pleased with this camera. Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Water proof camera
Reviews.Author: larissa ortiz
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because I was tired of taking my big digital camera with me and having to hide it when we are near a pool or beach.  this camera is perfect because it is small and does what I needed it to do.  I wanted to capture the fun moments when we are in or near water.  The pictures under water are amazing! And to my surprise, I love the video of above and underwater, which allows zoom.This is an inexpensive camera and is awesome to have as a second camera.  I would not take this camera if i wanted to take some good portrait family pics or pictures at a ballgame. As I mentioned, this will be the camera we use at the beach or for any water activities.I also have 3 boys that I do not let them touch my expensive digital camera.  This camera the boys can use and take pics.  This camera can be dropped (accidentally) and I will have no worries.  They can spill water or play in the sand with the camera, and again no worries from mom or dad!! Camera will be fine and boys love taking pictures!Definetly happy with the camera!

Reviews.Title: Poor photo quality_HD video sub par
Reviews.Author: S. Watkins
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace my Pentax Optio, a waterproof camera that's been great, but it's too old to accept the newer 4 GB cards.  I have several point and shoot digital cameras, that produce great results for me.  This camera was a huge disappointment. The auto 'scene' mode for shots produced horrible results.  I put the camera on "P" to avoid that problem, but still was unhappy with many of the photos.  As for video, anything less than the HD quality is phone camera quality (i.e., poor), but the HD is fairly poor also - it can be jerky and if fingers are in the wrong spot, very little audio is picked up.  Another reviewer commented on the ability of the glass lens to get spotty.... wow, were they right.  The lens can become spotty or smudged very easily.  Luckily I was able to return this camera.  Look else where for a good waterproof camera - you won't find it here.

Reviews.Title: Picture this!
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Henk
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera to take on board while racing sailboats, so I searched for waterproof, shockproof digital point & shoots.  I ended up choosing the Fuji FinePix XP10, because it said it fit these requirements and more.  I've used the camera for several events now, and like some aspects and dislike some others.  The camera provides high-quality pictures, at 12 MP, images are crisp and sharp.  Color saturation of images is very good.  It is easy to use and self-explanatory, I can hand the camera to another crew-member and they can figure it out quickly and without problems.I do have a couple of issues with the camera, though, simple things that would make it more practical and easier to use.  First,to turn off the beep sound (chime when camera is turned on/off, or when using the menu), you are required to hold a button down for 4 seconds - but this also cancels the flash - there is no way to turn off the beep without turning off the flash function.  It doesn't make sense to have to tie these two functions together electronically.  Second, although it has a large viewing screen, it is very difficult to see in bright daylight.  You are required to hold a hand over the screen to see the image - not handy when sailing a boat!  Third, the telephoto length of the lens is shorter than I would have liked.  It is hard to frame a distance shot using only the telephoto control.  I've figured that this is a symptom of the water-proof nature of the camera, for longer focal length, it would require a moving lens.  Finally, on my last camera, it was possible to enlarge and crop a picture while viewing it on the screen, this camera does not appear to have that option.The camera does what it promised, so I rate it high for those reasons.  I guess with a little more research on my part, I would have found that it lacked a couple of features that I had come to consider necessary for the type of photography I do.Fujifilm FinePix XP10 12 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Green)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Melisa M. Mitchell
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  The waterproof feature is fun.  You can actually take pics underwater.  I have dropped it on concrete and it did not affect it.  I have an expensive camera but did not want to take it with me out of the country and on the beach so I bought this camera.  It was a good choice it is durable and takes good quality pics.

Reviews.Title: The Little Waterproof Camera That Wasn't
Reviews.Author: T. Bradshaw
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after reading reviews on several websites, including here.  It was clear that some units had leakage problems but I decided to take the chance that they were isolated incidents and that the odds would be in my favor.  They were not.The camera showed up the day before we went to Mexico for a few days on the beaches of Tulum.  I took a number of pics before the camera's first trip into the water.  It went with us in a kayak and I took several shots both in and out of the water.  Later that day I took it snorkeling.  I started having some problems with it shutting off.  I could turn it back on and go again for a few pictures before it would cut out again.  I then noticed water in the lens.  At that point I gave up and put it in my pocket.  When I got back to the hotel and removed the SD card it was wet.I spent quite a bit of time trying to rinse and dry it.  I tried several times to start it up again throughout the trip with no success.  Fortunately I was able to return it for a full refund.  I'll look to other manufacturers for my next waterproof camera.The pics I managed to take were still on the SD card when I got home (fortunately I had my main camera along for the trip).  The non-water shots were fine...nothing spectacular.  The water shots looked like they were going to be OK but I've never shot underwater before so I can't rule out operator error affecting their quality.

Reviews.Title: Quite disappointed...
Reviews.Author: ManangK
Reviews.Content: This is the third P&S; Finepix that I have owned. I have to say for durability, they are perfect. I only switched to newer finepix cams because I wanted new ones...otherwise, the older ones made perfect pictures, were durable even after being dropped from 5-ft ht, despite being subjected to dust and oil (I am a foodblogger). The last one I owned before this was a 6MP finepix f10 and that had very great photos despite limited lighting; e.g., indoor lighting, nighttime (an improvement from the first 1.0 MP finepix I owned). Natural lighting on daylight have always been crisp.I bought this because of the waterproof, freezeproof features, as well as the stabilizing and the face detector. As I expected, photos are great. However, I was extremely disappointed with the photos I took of food, close up, under indoor lighting (I usually take photos of food at supper time). All yellowish...no matter what setting -- party, night, natural, suppressed flash, macro, etc. All jaundiced! If I do use flower setting with natural daylight coming from the windows (not night time), no matter how dark it is in my kitchen/dining area, the photos look great.  With f10, I just had to set on macro and suppress the flash even using artificial light (it enhances the light and the color) and I get clear photos of the food (with natural daylight from windows, I had to find a good angle to bring out great photos). I thought I could give my old cam to my son, but at least for purposes of foodblogging, I would still use it.Also, the thing with the underwater setting, it would not set to macro (but it would suppress flash).I will update more as I experience using this. I decided to keep this at least for outing,sightseeing purposes, etc. I will still use my 6MP finepix f10 for foodblogging purposes.

Reviews.Title: Awful pictures and no fun
Reviews.Author: ML

} } } Length:: 0:22 MinsCheck out the enclosed video made with this camera. Every time the zoom goes in or out, everything goes out of focus. As a result, you really can not zoom while shooting. And strangely, the vids can only be 12 minutes.This camera takes all of the fun out of photography. None of the shots I took outdoors on a summer evening at 6 PM (still 2+ hours of sunlight left) was any good. blurry, unsharp, bad autofocus... nothing good to say about it. I've had a number of better point and shoot cameras. This one I can not return fast enough....I shot about 40 stills... NONE of the shots is in focus and steady. I like the blurriness effect on two of the shots, but that is being generous.My everyday camera is a Nikon D3 with a Nikon Lens AF-S NIKKOR 24-70mm f/2.8G ED.It shoots amazing stills in low light, lightning autofocus, rapid multiframes.I got the Finepix x10 for its dustproof attribute, but I really don't think I can use it/enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: Nice idea, but has some flaws
Reviews.Author: CAW Mom "A Widay"
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera to use on vacation in Hawaii.  The unit is water tight and takes good photos in bright light on land. However...Images underwater are inconsistent and often grainy.  Backlight adjustment on indoor photos does not work well. After 4 days of moderate (a few hours) use in the ocean, the coating on the back of the camera buttons began to flake off.  Images can not easily be seen on the LCD in sunlight.  The proprietary charger and transfer cable are a nuisance to carry while traveling - would have been better if the camera had been made to work with a mini-USB.Not a bad camera, not a great camera - an adequate camera that I would not likely buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great waterproof camera!
Reviews.Author: S. D. Farver "Teacher Man"
Reviews.Content: I scoured reviews for waterproof cameras before deciding on this little beauty for our Alaskan adventure.I wanted something that was totally waterproof, shockproof, and freeze-proof and could fit in my pocket (as well as take decent pictures). Too many times I've missed shots because my camera was safely tucked away in a dry bag. Looking at the shots after our vacation, I'm very excited about my purchase! Having been a very satisfied Canon customer for a number of years, I had initially looked at the comparable D10; however, when I met a fellow traveler with the D10, I was even more convinced I had purchased the right camera (it was a bit bulkier than the Fuji).PROS--SizeThe Fuji fits perfectly in my front pocket whereas the D10 was a little too big for my liking.--Start up timeI was really impressed with how little time it took from pocket to picture--I was able to get some great wildlife shots while kayaking.--BatteryI was able to hold a charge and take over 300 pictures over 2 days. Charging took less than an hour.--StyleI didn't buy this to impress people, I just wanted a camera that could get wet--but every time I took it out, people seemed to comment on it (I have the green one).--Waterproof-nessI took pictures in sea water and fresh water (no deeper than an arm's length) with no problems. I'm excited to snorkel with it sometime soonCONS--SoundI haven't found a way to turn off the somewhat annoying start up sound, zoom sound and snapshot sound without also suppressing the flash--DisplayBecause the camera fits easily in a pocket, it's prone to getting scratched with whatever may be in your pocket (change, keys). Mine got a very small scratch on Day 1. Also, there is no viewfinder, so all pictures need to be framed with the display.I did like the picture quality, and the video was decent at best.All in all, I highly recommend this camera for someone who wants to be outdoors, take pictures, and not worry about equipment getting wet.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Garcia "Starcia"
Reviews.Content: We used this in Maui and it was priceless. The videos we have will last forever and are very clear. It is weird taking a new camera underwater, but it worked!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix XP10  Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Carole Hannigan
Reviews.Content: I loved the Fujifilm Fine Pix XP10 Digital Camera because it took great pictures and was very easy for me to operate.  I liked the fact that this camera will withstand all kinds of weather and is waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Red's Mom
Reviews.Content: We have taken this tubing and snorkeling and have had no issues with leakage or damage.  The only problem we have come across is blurry photos, but that's because we accidentally smeared waterproof sunscreen across the lens.  If we wipe the lens (on a towel or swimsuit) before shots, the photo quality is pretty good for a point and shoot camera, in or out of water.  This was a great investment because you can preview the photos, unlike the disposable waterproof cameras we've used in the past.  No issues with battery life, but we charge it daily on trips.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy any Fuji products
Reviews.Author: Phyllis dodds
Reviews.Content: I was given a Finepix XP100 as a Christmas gift in 2012 and when I tried to use it to take pictures snorkeling with the camera in September 2013 it was still under warranty. The seal leaked and allowed water into the camera and it no longer worked. I sent it in October 2013 under the one (1) year warranty with all the required documents and Fuji refused to honor it's warranty.  They were willing to "repair" it for $145 and the camera was only $150 brand new.  This is the second and absolutely the last time I will ever buy or recommend any Fuji products because both time they refused to honor the warranty they place on their products. I have owned cameras for the past 50 years and nothing has ever been as bad as Fuji. Fuji makes and sells JUNK.

Reviews.Title: It was great until I beat it too much - My fault...
Reviews.Author: J/D.
Reviews.Content: I used the hell out of this thing until it gave out! Eight mud races, 10+ snorkeling sessions in the ocean, and tons of other outdoor activities finally made it give out. While I hate to see something stop working, I truly feel like I got my money's worth out of it. I'll be buying another one soon!

Reviews.Title: I'd pass...Keep looking
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: Worked a few times but after it really did some under water usage it no longer worked properly. For the price I'm sure there's something better out there. I think it's better as "water resistant", but not waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: BendBuyer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because it is advertised as waterproof. Took it snorkeling in Hawaii. It is not waterproof at all. Camera is now broken! So disappointed. I have already replaced it with a Nikon.

Reviews.Title: not value for the money
Reviews.Author: Inara Lace
Reviews.Content: the quality of landscapes and night shoots is not good. the charger is not addapted to Europe. I needed to buy an adaptor.

Reviews.Title: FAIR UNDERWATER SHOTS
Reviews.Author: Bob in NH
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a vacation to Mexico and underwater intended shots.  The photos came out fair but not exceptional.Photo quality was just okay above water as well, glad I had another camera with me for vacation shots.  I own about 7 cameras of different styles for different reasons and took a chance on Fuji only because of the zoom ratio, megapix, and underwater capability for the price offered.  You get what you pay for !  Had a Fuji, years ago that wasn't so great, and figured over time they may have progressed in the market, but see no change.  Just spoiled with my Nikon line the most.

Reviews.Title: Is not 100% waterproof
Reviews.Author: Nicolas
Reviews.Content: I had problems with the camera because water come inside , the company sent me a new one, I used for a year taking pictures no under water, well 2 weeks ago we went to the West Coast and just took a picture under the water and the camera gone.I don't have warranty now, I think is NOT A REAL WATERPROOF CAMERA

Reviews.Title: It truly is water proof!
Reviews.Author: J. Webb
Reviews.Content: Dip this baby under the water... cause you can! I bought it cause it was shock proof and I drop my camera a lot! I was apprehensive about putting it under the water, but I thought what the hell YOLO! lol. SO, I did and the camera still works! I've had this camera about 2 years now and haven't had any issues, yet!

Reviews.Title: Control Your Expectations - But Keep In Mind The Environment!
Reviews.Author: Tobin Dallas
Reviews.Content: There are many reviews about the quality of the pictures that this camera can take - I'll skip all of that since beauty is the eye of the beholder.  For my limited opinion, the camera took decent shots for its form factor, size, resolution and the conditions that it was in.  Then throw in the fact that you are using it in water, sand, cold, snow, wind and any other sort of environment that is usually hostile to camera, the pictures are decent.  Was happy with short video clips shot in "video mode" with the camera, especially in the pool and just "under the surface" of the water.  The results were good, crisp and clear.  Found that navigation of the menu options could get a little annoying as they were non-intuitive, but for the most part the camera just was point and shoot.The only down side - the camera showed no signs of water intrusion, but three years later, it started acting "strange" - would not shut of, would get stuck in playback mode, and it was not possible to take ANY pictures or video with it.  RIP.  Time to spend another $300 to get a outdoor camera where you can't or don't want to take the Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Died on day 1.
Reviews.Author: Nelson Powers
Reviews.Content: This camera was basically DOA. It turned on twice, then never again. I will never buy a Fujifilm camera again.

Reviews.Title: Died within 1 week
Reviews.Author: Molasses Lindsay
Reviews.Content: Took the brand new camera on our honeymoon, and about a week in, it completely shut off while I was using it for snorkeling photos. Recharged the battery, let it dry out for awhile, but could not turn the camera back on. Waiting to see if it can be replaced or refunded, but judging by other reviews, it doesn't look hopeful...

Reviews.Title: Poor
Reviews.Author: Ettore Semeghini
Reviews.Content: After the first dive the camera leaked. The LCD display gets foggy. Then it stoped work at all. Not anymore.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this Camera
Reviews.Author: vsoul
Reviews.Content: I have had nothing but problems with this camera. It gets stuck where you cannot take pictures, so I have to take the battery out and put it back, by then the picture is no longer  worth taking. I need to return this horrible camera.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: D. Arbona
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift. But right out of the box it was not working. I thought it was the battery but it ended up being something wrong inside the camera. No worries, Fuji's warranty covered everything and had it back to me in less than a month. Ever since it has worked flawlessly under water, in the snow, on the beach, and just about everywhere in between where you would not take your smartphone. great all-around camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for outdoors; must use flash for indoors
Reviews.Author: mi
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for three years. I must say that I really love it. What I love most about it is the clear crisp pictures it takes. There are never red eye dots. When you use flash, it gives people a warm tan and makes the background black. The only drawback it has is that you can't use it indoors without flash. If you do, you get an orange color. It seems like the camera needs a lot of light to take pictures well. Good thing it comes with flash.I've dropped this camera more than once and it's still in good working condition. As for it being waterproof, I brought it out to the beach and water never got in the camera. The lenses did get foggy. I'm not sure if it was the weather or if the lenses are bad. I just splashed water on the lenses when it fogged up and it stayed clear for a while.Other reviewers seem to have lots of problems with this camera. I guess I was lucky and got a good one. I would recommend this camera, if you're trying to take great pictures outdoors or anywhere with bright lighting. Otherwise, you might want to look into other cameras. Whilst it's great for bright environments, it's not good for indoors unless you don't mind using flash (which is really bright). Hopes this helps.

Reviews.Title: Great for underwater
Reviews.Author: phillyj86
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a trip to Belize, where we would be snorkeling. Before using it under water, I had about a year and a half to play around with it out of water, or in situations with water splashes. Out of water, I was not impressed with the picture quality, color quality, etc. The video quality was satisfactory. In situations where I wasn't completely underwater, but just needed a water proof camera (like swimming in waterfalls), I can rarely get a good photo. Things fog up fairly easily. that being said, I was pleasantly surprised by how well my under water photos turned out. We snorkeled some coral reefs, and both the photos and video turned out great. Nothing fogged up, steamed up, or had condensation. The usability is pretty good with this camera. There are lots of menu features to choose from. It is a little difficult to push the zoom buttons, though. Overall, I would definitely recommend this camera for under water adventures, but use it only as a back up camera in other situations.

Reviews.Title: i love it.
Reviews.Author: ditchmedic
Reviews.Content: this camera was great. it took wonderful pictures on many vacations in the Carribbean. Unfortunately, I dropped it from waste high when I was on dry land and it broke. it is supposed to be shock proof but it's not.

Reviews.Title: Cheapy!
Reviews.Author: Dr.Lazo
Reviews.Content: In the first week of use, all the chrome felt apart, the focusing is too slow, and  in a video function is too glare instead the set ups!......BTW!....the water came in for the camera button!.... I dont recomend it!

Reviews.Title: Not too bad while it lasted.
Reviews.Author: S. Moon
Reviews.Content: While it worked it was a decent camera. We got a lot of enjoyment out of it, and it's great for taking to (and into) the pool.As an everyday camera it falls short -- low light shots are grainy. The lens has no cover so is always getting fingerprints.We took it in the ocean once, after which it refused to turn off (unless you removed the battery). Soaking in fresh water helped, but ultimately we had to get a warranty repair. A few months later it broke again and this time was no longer under warranty.This is the second and probably last Fuji water camera we will get.

Reviews.Title: Great underwater shots!
Reviews.Author: T. Gleason
Reviews.Content: I've owned this camera for over a year now.  I waited to review it because I wanted to use it in all types of situations.  This is a compact, easy to use camera, and my favorite shots have been under water!  My kids love to take it in the pool to get video and still shots while being silly in the water.  We've also used it at a local lake, and it took surprisingly great photos under the murky water as well!  I love that I can take this camera to the beach without worrying about ruining it if I drop it in the sand.  It has been in every weather condition imaginable, and is still in great condition.  Lenses are clear and unscratched, still waterproof, etc.It takes beautiful indoor and outdoor pictures at normal range, during the day.  Not the best night time/dark shots, but I have not found a point and shoot that does a good job in low light.  Pictures at a distance are very good too - for a point and shoot camera.  Not perfect pictures when sitting in the back of the auditorium at my children's concerts, but definitely better than most point and shoots.I have taken a lot of video with this camera, and the quality is excellent.  My only complaint is the lack of a pause feature while taking video.  When you select the video option, it automatically starts recording, rather than waiting for you to push a button to start recording.  This has caused many videos to start with scenes of the floor, or my lap, etc, then quickly panning up to the subject!  And when you stop, that video clip is over, and you have to start another clip to continue.  No way to stop/pause/restart and keep it all in one video.The lens does not "close", and there is no cover for the lens, which worried me at first, but after owning it for so long, and using it regularly in many different situations, I'm happy to report the lens is in great shape.  I would have expected it to be scratched and ruined by now, but no.Battery life is great, and the charger is compact and easy to take along.  Recharges the battery quickly as well.I plan to use this camera for a long time, and am very happy with it.  If you are looking for a compact point and shoot camera that works in the rain, in the water, in the sand, extreme heat and cold, this is for you!

Reviews.Title: buena
Reviews.Author: nestor pereira
Reviews.Content: rapido y seguro el servicio me gusto el producto porque era justo lo que vi es justo lo que me llego

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Bethany
Reviews.Content: Camera works well in all conditions, I was able to take it skiing with me as we'll as swimming with dolphins' amazing pictures and quality

Reviews.Title: Okay, but not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my daughter. Took it on vacation. took some great pictures both in and out of the swimming pools, but after the third or 4th day of the vacation, failed after being taken into the pool.

Reviews.Title: took to rain forest
Reviews.Author: mlong
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable results.  We were under water, in rain and on beach.  Never failed to produce wonderful photos.  Compact and easy.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm XP waterproof
Reviews.Author: os
Reviews.Content: This camera produced low quality pictures regardless of the settings.  Then, we took it on our honeymoon to Hawaii and after a few minutes of use while we snorkeling, it died.  Apparently the "water/shock/dust/freeze proof" claim on the front of the camera is a myth.  Don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm XP 10;  Found this camera in the surf.
Reviews.Author: Beach Hunter
Reviews.Content: I metal detect the beaches and spend most of my time up to my neck in salt water. I found a Fujifilm FinePix XP 10 in about two feet of water buried under about eight inches of wet sand. I dig a lot of cell phones that are ruined by the ocean water and figured that was what I had found.  I put it in my pocket and worked the water for another couple of hours with the camera submerged in the salt water. I realized it was a camera when I got home. Blew the sand off with canned air and turned it on. It works like a charm.  There is no way to know how long it had been buried in the surf but it was deep enough under the sand  to indicate at least a couple of days.  I can verify that they are undoubtedly waterproof!

Reviews.Title: Superb Camera
Reviews.Author: Hans G Luetkemeier
Reviews.Content: Needed a waterproof camera to take on a trip to the Bahamas. Was skeptical at first but for the price I thought it was worth the investment. This camera completely exceeded my expectations. I was able to take a lot of good underwater photos as well as knocked the camera around on the beach a bit in the sand. It was a perfect camera for this type of trip. The flash also worked well when we took photos at night. Strongly recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for a portable, durable, waterproof camera to take on a trip. It's well worth the investment - I hope to keep it for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Exceeded my expectations
Reviews.Author: Aaron A. Tyler
Reviews.Content: My poor Fujifilm XP10 died this week of salt water injestion.  After falling in gravel, and taking pictures in sleet at the cabin,  Afgan sandstorms, falling in irrigation canals, explosions, being jumped on (repeatedly) and riding around in my cargo pocket for an entire deployment it still worked flawlessly until the 13th hour of snorkeling when I exceeded its design depth and got a few drips of water in the battery door but couldn't get it dried out completely...the good news is there are even better ones now!

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Timothy Knowles
Reviews.Content: Terrible quality.Only used the camera three times while snorkling and rafting. Was only submerged briefly in shallow water. Took less than 50 pictures.On the third use, the camera shut itself off. It would not power up. Recharged the battery again (tried 2). Still would not power up when the on/off button was pushed.The on/off switch seems to be defective.Expensive disposable camera.

Reviews.Title: Got a couple of great underwater shots....except the battery chamber kept on getting water logged!!!
Reviews.Author: Alice L.
Reviews.Content: Great camera with great potential, except the battery chamber would prop open underwater at unexpected moments (I am thinking due to the awkward location of the chamber button), rendering the camera useless and water-logged after only a few shots!  I had to return the camera TWICE to Fuji Repair shop in Edison, NJ..and they were great about repairing it for free and shipping them free of charge each time...but on the second time, they upgraded me to a newer model, which (fortunately!) doesn't suffer from the same ailment as this model (they got smart and placed the button to the battery chamber ELSEWHERE on the camera!).

Reviews.Title: NOT WATER PROOF
Reviews.Author: Meek1
Reviews.Content: DON'T DO IT :)  This camera is not waterproof as advertised and this is why......Throw out the notion that 91 other morons that wrote reviews "did not close the door correctly".  Some probably didn't but I'm certain most were able to accomplish this given that we all know how a little water can kill our most prized electronics.  The problem has to do with the thickness of the battery/usb hatch and the placement of the rubber seals.  The hatches are thick and the seals are at the very bottom inside portion of the hatch.  This design creates a sweet nesting spot for water. Open the door before that water is evaporated and wallah you are now the proud owner of 21st century techno waste.  So if you Fuji knuckleheads read these posts please fire your design team and hire people that are more likely to think through the actual use of your product.  Dunking it once in your office fish tank and silkscreening WATERPROOF across its case just isn't prudent.

Reviews.Title: Perfect purchase for our cruise!
Reviews.Author: Rusty
Reviews.Content: I have a normal digital camera but bought this one so I would be OK with it getting wet. I don't think I even used my regular camera the entire time. I strapped this camera to my wrist and went snorkeling, diving, swam with dolphins and even sting rays. All of the other people were asking about the camera getting wet, but I assured them that it was fine. Each night I uploaded the pics from the camera (just in case I lost it, I would have the pics taken so far on my laptop.) The pictures taken out of the water were just as good if not better than my regular digital camera, but the pictures taken underwater were amazing. I will post a couple of them to show the camera's quality.When I purchased this, it came with a carrying case, tripod, 2GB memory card, memory card USB adapter, battery charger, and little 6" tripod. Everything was included, and I never even had to buy a better memory. 2GB is plenty for a seven day cruise.I really wanted the blue colored camera, and I think I paid a little extra for it, but I have no regrets. This has become our primary camera to bring everywhere (when we remember) because it is so durable and its OK if we drop in in water (or more likely, spill beer on it).Oh, I also recorded a movie of my fianc3 swimming with a dolphin and it came out just as good as the pictures.This camera says that it was refurbished but I cannot tell. It looks and works like it was brand new. That may change by seller, but I could not be happier with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Was a gift
Reviews.Author: IRENA
Reviews.Content: 17 yr. old granddaughter loves her camera and the color makes her look "cool" using it.  Takes good photos, very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: durable, but takes awful pictures
Reviews.Author: docgoat
Reviews.Content: Disappointed is the best word I can use to describe my experience with this camera.  I quickly went and bought a Panasonic that is not touted as an all-around sports camera, yet is just as tough and takes photos that are 10x the quality of this camera.  If I were to estimate the percentage of photos taken that are good enough to show friends or family, I would say roughly 20%.  Simply a waste of money.  I've always gone with Panasonic/Lumix and should've have been uppity about the claim of ultra tough.

Reviews.Title: Find another camera
Reviews.Author: CKH
Reviews.Content: I only post reviews when I have strong feelings, positive or negative. Unfortunately in this case it's the latter. I bought this camera because of the claim that it was waterproof. But alas, it is not. This camera is "water resistant". You can leave it in the rain, splash water on it, and take it on a boat. However, don't try to swim with it. I assumed the claim that it was waterproof to 10 feet to be true and I now have a paperweight. Oh well, the SD card is still good. That is dry, I just can't turn the camera on, as the on/off button no longer works.

Reviews.Title: Very poor quality pics
Reviews.Author: cocacola
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my first trip to sky in Vail, Co. What a bad decision was to get this camera!!! None of the pictures came out sharp. I m an amateur photographer and all my vacation pictures are praised by friends and family, I can not even show this ones. The videos look like a 1960's homemade videos, red and pale colors... what a joke is this camera. Once I returned this garbage , the sales person said that nobody like this camera, it really sucks!Save money buy a Pentax waterproof or Olympus waterproof, just  don't waist your money with this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: K. Teribury "Mrs Terryberry"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera in 2010 specifically for a trip to Mexico. Used it the whole time. Underwater, in the water, in the sand...etc. Pictures were the best of any camera I've ever had.Took this camera last year on a 5000 mile motorcycle trip.  Survived many drops, ocean, pool, etc.....this was a great camera.No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Is NOT water proof as claimed!!!
Reviews.Author: wmedina
Reviews.Content: My 4 yr old is taking swimming lessons so I decided to buy a new camera that's waterproof, sturdy and would be ready for summer time outdoor activities.  I also got sold by the product's marketed quality.  First day in the pool, I decided to put the camera in my pocket and help my son with his swimming lessons. I pulled out to snap the first picture and found out it does not work and water has leaked inside the camera LCD display and lenses.  ....THAT WAS THE END OF THIS CAMERA!!! WHAT A DISSAPOINTMENT!!!!  Returned the camera to Costco Warehouse where I bought it and had no problem with return.  I'm looking for other name brads like Canon, Nikon or Sony.  DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA>

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality.  Water Leaks In.
Reviews.Author: Julia Rhi
Reviews.Content: I've used this camera on three trips for basic beach shots.  Not diving or anything like that.  On the third trip, water leaked in and it is not working now.  This camera is poorly built and not user friendly.  It's a cheaper alternative to the Olympus waterproof shockproof camera but not worth it considering how fast it breaks.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Scgardner
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a year ago for taking pics and video underwater. I live in San Diego, so the camera ia always exposed to salt water. I have never had a issue with its ability to be water proof. I have even gone deeper than the reccomended depth. The pics are clear and the video is excellent. I would deffinately reccomend this or the newer XP20 version.

Reviews.Title: not what i wanted
Reviews.Author: naturegirl
Reviews.Content: As an outdoor enthusiast, I had been scouting for a perfect shock-proof, waterproof, cold-proof camera after a frozen shutter on a dogsledding trip.  My parents offered to buy one for me, and I chose a pentax model. Instead, they thought they were saving money on this Fuji on sale.  Turns out, it was just a cheap camera.I have not fully submerged the camera yet, and other reviews are making me nervous to.  I had an impossible time taking pictures in the falling snow (either flash on snowflakes, or yellow blur without flash), and image quality in low light or indoors is TERRIBLE. We're talking black becomes purple and mid-tones have a lot of noise. Without flash, this camera can not focus indoors.Took a picture of a black and white mural I painted, indoors, lit by a whole room full of fluorescent lights, no flash. Resulting image is purple and yellowish and very, very, grainy.Also has very slow shutter speed and response time so I keep missing the "moments".On/off button is too small to use with gloves on.Very disappointed. Sorry parents, but going to fork out the extra $100 for one I really trust to document my adventures.

Reviews.Title: Basic Camera....Nothing Special
Reviews.Author: AuburnTygr
