Reviews.Content: The Fujifilm FinePix XP10 camera is a simple, basic, easy to use camera with a few good features (water, shock, dust and freeze proof).As for being waterproof, I have used it outside in damp drizzly weather and it continues to work fine but I have not dropped it into water so I don't know what would happen if it was totally immersed.The camera has been left in an unheated area for extended periods where the temperature dropped below freezing and is still operating.The camera is also easier to hold, for those with medium to large fingers, than some of the smaller models on the market.The 2.7 Inch LCD screen is a nice size to view pictures.No problems with the Optical Zoom.Now, the not so good:The picture quality and color is inconsistent and the delay in taking several pictures in a row is very slow.  I was outside today and noticed some Easter Lilies blooming in my back yard, unusual for January, so I wanted to take a few pictures.  I snapped three pictures in a row with the first picture beautiful, the second blurry and the third didn't take at all.The video has average picture quality but the sound breaks up and stops in various places throughout each video. This may be a defect in my camera but it is annoying although I don't use the feature often.I am not a camera expert and no longer carry a camera with me everywhere, as I did when my children were toddlers but I like to have a camera on hand just in case.  As a basic point and shoot camera when you're not in a hurry to capture action, this works fine but there are better cameras available.

Reviews.Title: Fuji needs a reality check
Reviews.Author: Amazon_user
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera one day prior to leaving for a trip. Read the reviews and crossed my fingers that it would not fail me. It took GREAT test pictures in the hotel. Even took a few GREAT pictures while snorkeling. Then it died. I called Fuji and they told me the camera only has problems when the side door isn't closed properly. I guess me and hundreds of other people do not know how to close the door properly. Fuji needs to redesign the camera. I took the camera back to the store and received a refund. The positive is I have about 8 great underwater photos and got a full refund.

Reviews.Title: hate it
Reviews.Author: Dezzy
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for Christmas. I took it on a 1 mile hike, took a few pictures under water in a creek, and a few of my dogs next thing I know is i got home and the "auto focus" wasn't working. I tried everything resetting the whole thing. Finally I called Fujifilm they didn't know what to do they had terrible customer service and they wanted us to send it back (paying for shipping) so they could "look" at it and send it back to us "fixed". I strongly do not recommend but if you want to waste your money go ahead it yours!

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: Woo "Woo"
Reviews.Content: I was given this camera as a gift at Christmas as I live near the beach where waterproofing is important. I read the instruction manual and made sure everything that was supposed to be shut was shut, after being submerged in only a few inches of water it stopped working. When I did open it later it was wet inside, judging by the other reviews I'm not even going to bother sending it away to get fixed. Maybe this was a faulty batch, this  is the first fujifilm I've had and it'll be my last.

Reviews.Title: It is NOT waterproof!
Reviews.Author: Kristophoros "out_of_lane_1"
Reviews.Content: This camera is NOT waterproof.  It worked on my first underwater experience in the Mediterranean and then when I took it to Thailand (at the climax of my tour), water got in it at Phi Phi Island (I made sure it was fully sealed before taking it underwater)!  I am pretty bummed because it was a great camera besides that.  So, I highly recommend NOT getting this camera if you intend to use it underwater.

Reviews.Title: Not happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: Old Thingy
Reviews.Content: I was given this camera as a present so shouldn't complain. It was because I wanted to take some underwater pictures and videos.First let me say that the position of the lense is ridiculous - to avoid getting hundreds of pictures of your left index finger you have to hold the camera in an un-natural grip which then invokes camera shake.I have a five year old Samsung 10Mpix camera which produces fantastic quality pictures(not underwater of course).One would think at 14Mpixles the Fujifilm FinePix XP would have better quality. Not so - the lense is pathetic.The pictures are not very sharp and need a lot of expertise in software manipulation to correct.The features & options menu is difficult to navigate and after months I have still not found how to manually set timing and aperture.This camera is best left underwater for the fish to play with. I have given it one star only because you cannot post this message with nil points.

Reviews.Title: Excelente producto. lo recomiendo
Reviews.Author: Christian Barrios
Reviews.Content: Excelente camara, la recomiendo 100%. llego lo que esperaba en su caja totalmente sellada. Trajo todos los manuales, cargador, cateria, cable USB y cuerda

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: Amazon'r
Reviews.Content: I bought this for our honeymoon in Hawaii. Upon purchase I realized the quality of the pictures was pretty bad. It looks foggy or blurry in most the pictures but I chalked that up to this being a cheap camera and also waterproof. After 3 times in water the camera started to not work. It would turn on then turn right off. The only plus was my memory card was salvaged.When I contacted Fuji they wouldn't say that they would replace the camera. They insisted I send it in and have one of their techs look at it. I paid shipping and when they looked at it they determined they could fix it for 55 bucks. I declined. I'd rather keep my money and buy a good camera.Lesson learned, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Rugged is the best I can say for this camera
Reviews.Author: D. Heuschele
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because of the shockproof and waterproof features but I had hoped it would be good at taking pictures (it is the primary function of a camera).I have owned this camera for about a year and it has been banged about pretty good and is still operational.  Unfortunately that is about the best thing I can say about it.If conditions are good it can take good pictures.  However, it does not handle light constasts well or movement of camera or subject well.  It has a significant glare issue.  The flash is real weak even for a point and shoot which usually have weak flashes.I get some good photos, some OK photos, and many not so good photos that other cameras would have been able to get good photos (I have owned all of the major camera competition except Sony and Nikon (I have owned Kodak, Canon, Olympus, and Casio) and this camera's photos are at or near the bottom).The video feature works about on par with other point and shoot cameras that I have used but the point and shoot video is not good (I would never compare it to a video camera).  At least in this area it seems to be about par with other point and shoot cameras.I have had water get in the waterproof camera.  The camera ended up surviving it but there was no reason that water should have gotten into it.  The camera was at or near the surface at all times.  The battery compartment was property closed.  When it got water in it the water could be seen on the display and every picture taken after this shows the water.  Unfortunately it was the only camera I had for a week in the Sierras so I could not simply use another camera.I would recommend you try a different ruggid camera, I doubt it could be much worse.Ruggedness: A (no complaints here it has taken a fair beating and still works)Photos: DWaterproof: D- (considering it should be waterproof).

Reviews.Title: Very durable - a good vacation camera
Reviews.Author: Gregory Motes "FA53"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife for Mother's day.  She has gone through a number of cameras over the past few years, some very cheap, some pretty expensive. She actually sent me the link to this camera and actually had meant to send something else, so when she saw it was the "green" one, we both had a bit of remorse that our communication on what she wanted wasn't as smooth as it should have been.  Still, this was $100 or so less than whatever it is that she wanted, so she decided to give it a go over the summer.For the things that she wanted to do - take pictures at the pool, the beach, and water parks - this camera has held up very well over the past 6 months.  Not a great camera for taking inside pictures and really doesn't have a ton of features that I'd like on my camera, put when it comes to taking pictures and having the confidence that the camera will hold up to the elements, this works well. One thing she really likes is that switching from still pictures to video is very easy.  Otherwise, her simple needs were met with this and we have both been generally pleased.Note, the price has actually gone up since we bought it at $115.85.  I'd probably give it the same review at the current store price of $189.I see that some of the reviews say the picture quality was poor. We have been satisfied with the pictures we have taken - though, again, the pictures we have taken have been in plenty of light, and we weren't looking for a super high resolution camera when we bought it.

Reviews.Title: Hands down, the worst camera I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: Gabriel Young
Reviews.Content: Having several young ones at home, I thought this was a good value camera that could withstand a beating. Sadly, this camera fails in so many ways.-PICTURES-Some of the worst pics I've ever seen from a digital camera. Really, 12 MP? My 10 year old, 5 MP Canon blows this thing away! This thing is bad overall but absolutely terrible in low light and when taking pics of moving objects.-VIDEO-Surprisingly OK videos. Just don't zoom because that's really loud on the recording.-DURABILITY-Worked fine in the water. Seemed waterproof, dustproof, and shockproof (never tried freeze). The problem is that this thing breaks on its own. It locks up frequently and I have to remove the battery to turn this off. This happened most often when viewing pics.-USABILITY-Not the smallest sub-compact out there but small enough to slide in just about any pocket. Overall, pretty easy to operate.-AMAZON CUSTOMER SERVICE-Amazon replaced this for me but the second camera had the same problem. Honestly, I didn't even want to give it a second chance but the same exact locking up issue in both cameras? Thank you Amazon for refunding my money on this dud.-RECOMMENDATION-Stay far, far away.

Reviews.Title: Just don't put it underwater
Reviews.Author: John Campbell
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures, just don't put it underwater.  It took on water immediately after being submerged for the second time.  Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: LossKauai
Reviews.Author: jjp1
Reviews.Content: This camera broke the third time using it.  Do not buy, we were stuck with this piece of junk on our vacation to Kauai.  The buttons start working for whatever reason.

Reviews.Title: Broke in no time
Reviews.Author: Misha
Reviews.Content: Broke the first time we took it under water...we shipped it back to the manufacturer, they were asking $50 for the camera to be fixed.

Reviews.Title: complete waste of money
Reviews.Author: Stan
Reviews.Content: The camera works just long enough to void warranties.  After it got wet in a pool, with the floatation device on it to keep it from sinking it no longer works at all.  This is a total disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Underwater Camera
Reviews.Author: Florida
Reviews.Content: The battery came buldging and would not fit in the camera nor charge...my daughter needed the camera for a class trip to the Florida Keys and arrived not working properly.  This was the second time for this camera, since we returned the original because of spots on the lense.  I would not recommend..constant problems.

Reviews.Title: Toddler Proof
Reviews.Author: Aimee in MI
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera- I have had it for about a year and taken it everwhere: Swimming, to the beach, and most importantly: home. I have an active 2 year old who LOVES this camera- and it's toddler proof. It's sold as waterproof, dustproof, freezeproof, and drop-proof: So far we only haven't tested the freezing of the camera. I'd like to add that it's crumb-proof, toilet-proof (too big to flush, btw), and thrown-down-the-stairs-proof. I originally bought this camera because after going to Great Wolf Lodge with a disposable waterproof camera and having none of the pictures turn out because there wasn't enough light, so I needed a camera with a flash. I wanted something that would properly document our trip the following year. Mission accomplished.Also, the battery charges quickly, and the charger is cool because you plug the battery into the charger, fold out the plug, and there you go- the battery and the inside of the camera are marked with yellow and arrows, so you don't have to worry about putting it in upside down.I recommend this to anyone with kids.The only feature I would have liked to have seen is a lens cover that protects the lens when the camera is off. I have lost a different camera (and my daughter's first summer) due to a cracked lens, so I'm particularly sensitive to this issue.Another feature that I would have liked this camera to come with is a floating leash: But I just looped the camera strap to my bathing suit shoulder strap to keep it from getting away from me. I guess if they made the camera floatable too then it would be too bulky to tuck into a pocket.All in all, I'm very pleased with the camera.

Reviews.Title: picture quality not as expected
Reviews.Author: Gerardo G. Sierra Corral "GerSiCo"
Reviews.Content: while the features of resisting water,dust, ice cold, etc are very attractive from this camera you have to take into account it has a price, you need constantly to make sure the protective crystal covering the lens is always sharp clean or your picture will be always blur or like foggy. My wife was very exited since her last 2 cameras suffered water and dust accidents with the kids but now is dissapointed, as me, with quality after printing.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Hotlou
Reviews.Content: I get so many compliments on my new camera, it did just what it was suppose to do, take underwater pictures. I did great out the water and honestly I do not use my old camera at all. Pictures were clear and I love the no limits of where I can take pictures.

Reviews.Title: Warranty won't cover it.
Reviews.Author: San
Reviews.Content: Fuji film warranty one of the worst. They would find any excuse not to cover the repairs. Like water damage , not bought from an authorized dealer etc

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm XP10.  Good as a low price underwater camera
Reviews.Author: Randy
Reviews.Content: I have owned the Fujifilm XP10 for a little over a year now.  I have taken it on two different snorkel trips and it has worked fine.  I must add that I bought this specifically for underwater video use, and that anyone who is expecting stellar pictures/video from it should look elsewhere.  Here are a few items of note:Pros:1.  Worked underwater over a two-year period on two different 10-day snorkel trips.  Submerged in water for dozens and dozens of hours, with no leaks.2.  Video is descent.3.  Battery life isn't too bad.  I had it in the water for up to two hours at a time on one battery, with the camera on (LCD in auto dim mode).Cons:1.  While the video and pictures are not bad, there are cameras in this same class that take much better pictures and video.  I would only look at this for the underwater capability.2.  I wish the video was 1080p, instead of 720p, but I knew that when I bought it.3.  Has trouble sometimes with autofocus.  In reviewing the video that was taken, about 5% - 10% would be blurry.There are more highly rated underwater cameras available that take 1080p video. If I was able to use it more often than I do, I would invest in one of those.  However, if you're looking for a cheap camera for underwater use, I have found this camera to provide good results for the money.

Reviews.Title: If you enjoy quality this isn't it.
Reviews.Author: Anne_gella
Reviews.Content: I have a very nice canon but it is very large and bulky. All I wanted was a nice camera to throw in my purse to take pictures whenever and one I could hand off to my husband to take hunting for all the trophy pics. The quality of these pictures are crap and it takes a long time to take a darn picture too. It takes even worse indoor pictures. If you want a good quality camera don't buy this one.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: rachellematt
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a year ago. It lasted about that long before quitting completely. It doesn't even turn on now. Prior to that, the shutter speed was intolerable. Subject would have to sit for up to 5 seconds for the photo to take. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: Decent, but cheaply made...
Reviews.Author: Kathryn Giardino "kgiardino"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for 10 months and took it snorkeling, to a pool, to a tubing adventure. Other than that, the camera has only seen occasional use. The picture quality is okay, but it is no Canon or Nikon.  The back of the camera is delaminating... the coating on the rubber buttons is peeling off.  I called Fuji to see if they would fix it under warranty, and they told me that it would be considered physical abuse and they will not cover it.  Not having abused the camera other than taking it in the ocean/pool (which is why I bought this camera), I am bothered that they would say that is physical abuse.Also, in the manual it suggest replacing the rubber seals on the battery compartment at least annually if you plan to use it in water.  Going to send it in to see what this costs....  Overall, I am disappointed with the quality.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad cheaper waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: Kyle R. Simmons
Reviews.Content: After owning this for over a year I am here to submit a review. I use this mostly for taking pictures while fishing. It has seen alot of rain and some snow while out fishing. It handles the cold and hot weather stuffed in my boats glove box. It also handles the vibrations of the boat well. The night shots on this are not bad. Day time pictures are great. I have taken this on a canoe trip and it endured swimming around taking pictures in the water and has had no problems. I would buy this again as a replacement if the one I have ever fails.Rated 4 stars as I was told the night shots with the flash would be better after contacting several "camera store and the manufacture" before purchase. I have had some great night shots from it but most are a little grainey. Could be me or could be the camera. Dont know.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Waterproof Camera is Boating Compatible!
Reviews.Author: Skipper Steve
Reviews.Content: I got the Fuji because I wanted a camera that would take photos of our boat and the grandkids from and in the water. I've only used it a couple of times, and the results have been excellent! This is my fourth Fuji camera so I had some experience on which to base my purchase decision. Would recommend it to anyone looking for a quality, waterproof camera (without a view finder).

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk.
Reviews.Author: wtam63
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your money buying this camera.  My wife and I have one for two weeks and the LCD stopped working.  Save your money and invest in a GoPro instead.

Reviews.Title: Stress-Inducer
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: Got this camera as a gift, so when I first started using it and the picture quality seemed strange, I figured I should at least keep giving it a try to see if it was my fault or I had the settings wrong.  Many trips into using this camera the photographs are still of horrible quality- contrast is terrible, often blurry, takes forever to shoot, and I always end up disappointed at the end of a trip when I realize I have no real documentation.  I've tried desperately photoshopping photos to improve them but they still never look quite right.  Seems to be a major lighting issue.  Haven't tried using it underwater but I am afraid to after all the reviews about these cameras breaking.  Hoping I can return it to Costco and invest in a Canon. Ugh.

Reviews.Title: terrible software
Reviews.Author: Aron
Reviews.Content: Camera seemed okay with the exception of the charger. Removing the battery to charge is a horrible design flaw. Software would not work at all with my computer, even though I was well above the system requirements.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy a FinPix underwater camera from FujiFilm
Reviews.Author: D. A. Abbott "HukerDoug"
Reviews.Content: I bought a FinePix xp10 in March. I tried it out in a swimming pool. It leaked. I sent it back for repair over 3 months ago. I have called their service department 7 times and got the same lie: "We have one in stock, not the same color, but will send it right out". I just tried again today 21 September and got the same lie. Don't buy a FujiFilm camera and expect to get any kind of fast and honest repair service. They will lie. Try the Canon underwater camera; my friend has it and it works great. DA, Lincoln, NE

Reviews.Title: Not pleased
Reviews.Author: Kasia L
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is surprisingly disappointing with the automatic setting, underwater pictures are only ok.  But I have had this camera for less than 6 months and it's the second time I'll be sending it to get fixed because of the same problem.  The camera just says zooming error and turns off.  I would just write it off as "it happens"  but the same thing happen with my friends camera same model just a few months older.

Reviews.Title: Not even water resistant
Reviews.Author: A. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I don't personally own this camera, however my in-laws do. We were in Maui, HI when we tried out this little gem. They had to send back 2 previous cameras, so we figured we'd try it one more time. My husband and I were snorkeling when the camera suddenly shut off. It did turn back on, however the screen filled completely with water and, after shutting off a second time, it wouldn't even turn back on. In theory, this is a great camera. I'm sure that there are people who have had amazing experiences with this camera, however we were definitely not one of them. When they talked to the gal at Costco (where they purchased the camera) she had said that there were several others who were returning this camera because of the same problems. After 3 duds, and several others with the same problem, I don't think I'd personally risk investing my money into this camera. For nearly $200 I'd like a waterproof camera that didn't fill up with water at 2 ft.

Reviews.Title: Camera is great! The battery is not!!!
Reviews.Author: Cooperchic
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice camera! Light weight, feels great, easy to hold. The picture quality is outstanding. Its just that the battery won't take a full charge!  I had to replace the battery after a month.

Reviews.Title: Don't listen to the negative reviews! Great affordable camera!
Reviews.Author: TexasAud10
Reviews.Content: I have taken this camera on two cruises and it has been an amazing thing to have! I'm wondering if the people who say it isn't waterproof are opening the battery/memory card compartment and not closing it back fully before they get it wet. I've never had any problems, and I've taken this thing snorkeling in the ocean and dove down to about 10 feet with it! I'm still trying to play around with and figure out all the different settings so I can get the best pictures, but the quality is very good! I have been very pleased with the pictures and videos. Very durable and the battery lasted with it constantly on for several hours snorkeling, parasailing, and being on the beach. Easy to figure out and very stylish. It's a great camera for the price and you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Perfect little camera for water bound trips
Reviews.Author: Ohioan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera while on a cruise. The price point is great for all that you get. It's easy to use, takes nice crisp photos and is water proof (to a point - I didn't try it beyond its limits). It has some extra bells and whistles, but the features to capture nice photos are easy to use, and for me, that's a plus.I have another camera with advance technology like superior zoom capability and ability to capture action shots, and many more features. And while that is nice, I prefer the little Fuji for photos while you're having fun and don't want all the fuss.We got some really beautiful shots with this little gem. And it fits easily in even a small bag. And the handy straps (and little life jacket) are a good safety measure when your in the waves, so it shouldn't come off, but if it does, the little "life" jacket will keep it afloat!A fun camera. Highly recommend for vacations in the elements.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: George
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to replace my Olympus Stylus Tough 8010.  It was a last minute purchase the day before our annual trip.  The Olympus was the first camera like this I owned and did not relize that I should be checking the seals, etc. or changing them, to protect the camera.  Big mistake.  Compared to the Olympus, I would have been better off spending double to replace it.  By the time the trip ended, it was too late to return the piece of junk.  Seriously, the photos are pathetic, rarely in focus and the flash, it not worth turning on, it does not improve the photo quality.  I have a big DSLR other point and shoots - they are so much more convenient at times.  I love the underwater feature these type have for the beach and pool.  In comparison, I think a disposable would produce better quality photos than this Fuji.  I misplaced the camera for a few months and just downloaded the photos.  It is so unfortunate that I have to keep the lousy photos I have, as they are the only ones of the trip and a birthday.  They are so bad, I can't even offer it to anyone........there is no point, I would not be doing anyone a favor.  I thought I'd be able to keep it and take daytime photos - as the evening ones with the flash are all a brownish yellow and blurry, but cannot see the point of carrying two cameras. This purchase was a huge disapointment.

Reviews.Title: decent waterproof outdoor camera
Reviews.Author: Enrique
Reviews.Content: I've owned a few Fuji cameras before, but this is my first waterproof camera. After reading mixed reviews, I thought the price point was worth the expense, and the camera was worth it for a vacation in Barbados. This was our go to camera on the beach and in the water. It was rained on and dunked in the ocean and still works. We did not use it to take any underwater pictures. The 5x zoom made this waterproof camera stand out among others in the same price range for me.What I didn't like about the camera - no lens cover. Some of our shots were ruined because the plastic lens had sunscreen or fingerprints on it. I'm also not a fan of the scene recognition auto mode. When you want to take a quick picture, just use the regular auto mode. Sometimes when you are attempting to take a picture using scene recognition, it will make some bizarre choices based on lighting and motion in the frame. Also, indoors and night pictures didn't turn out so well either. However, that's what I've got a much nicer point and shoot for, this was meant to be a cheap outdoor camera from the start.Ultimately, worth the price I paid, but I wish I'd known to check and clean the lens with a soft cloth every time before snapping a picture. More of my holiday shots would have turned out better. If this camera gets lost or stolen, I'd look at the current crop of waterproof cameras and see what's out there. I'm sure there have been a few improvements in the image quality and features.

Reviews.Title: Paint Chipped and Power Button Clogged
Reviews.Author: haylyon
Reviews.Content: I had had this camera for almost a week and i had brought it in the ocean maybe 2 times. By the third time we were at the beach i noticed the green paint chipping off the camera, leaving it silver, and sand go into the power button so i couldnt turn it on. I dont blame them for the sand, but they couldnt have done anything to make the paint a little bit more hardy? Not a good choice if you want your camera to remain new-looking for a long time. unless you bring it in the water in a plastic bag.

Reviews.Title: Happy So Far
Reviews.Author: D. Reich
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Fujifilm Finepix XP10 a few weeks ago and have used it several times in and out of the water.  So far I'm very happy with my purchase.  It takes great underwater pics and when used for a large group photo on dry land the picture turned out great too.  This camera could easily become my everyday point and shoot favorite.  We're going to Cancun in a few weeks and I can't wait to try it out while snorkeling in the clear water down there!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Judee Cirillo
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my daughter to use and it is great.  She has used it in the pool taking pictures and videos and it works great.  Also took it to the beach and brought it in the water.  It was great not to have to worry about getting it wet.  That took sometime getting use to.  Very good product.

Reviews.Title: Exceptional Undewater Camera --Used in the Galapagos
Reviews.Author: Galapagos
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great inexpensive alternative to an underwater fancy camera.  It takes exceptional video underwater.  If you can get close to your subject underwater (Even saltwater as I took it to the Galapagoes) you will have a national geographic type of picture.  Loved it.  Recommend it and great job Fuji!

Reviews.Title: broke down in less than 100 pictures
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Colon
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera for a 2-week vacation which included significant amounts of beach time.  Shot about 50 pictures with it.  It held on well in the beach environment and did not have any problems with immersion in saltwater up to ten feet during regular swimming, shallow snorkeling, and hanging in the water.  The picture quality was unremarkable, low for my taste, but it could be a tradeoff you make for most cameras of this type.  Before the end of the trip it refused to power on anymore, so I returned it to the Costco for a store credit.

Reviews.Title: Solid Water Resistant Camera for a Good Price
Reviews.Author: Socalbryan
Reviews.Content: I paid $100 for this camera and I pretty much got what I expected: A solid camera with reasonable picture quality and good battery life.I've used this camera in three environments: while paddle boarding in the bay, while lounging in the water at Lake Havasu and while partaking in the Camp Pendleton Mud Run.  So far, it's been great.During paddle boarding, the biggest risk it faces is me dropping it in the ocean (it doesn't float). I rarely fall in the water, but when I do, I know my camera is safe.  The camera gives allows me to paddle board without having to worry about ruining my camera if I fall.Pros:- It's affordable.- It's compact.- It's has a decent flash which I found quite handy for determining how much of the bow line I managed to get wrapped around the propeller of my buddy's boat.- The video feature works well.Negatives:- It doesn't float. I solved this issue by attaching a couple of key-ring floaties to it - foam key chains typically used by recreational boaters to keep their keys from sinking. Basically, it's a non-issue once you get the floating device.- Sand is it's mortal enemy.  I took this camera through the Camp Pendleton Mud Run- a 10-k run through water, obstacles and hills. While the camera handled the water and the occasional bumps during the obstacles, it didn't exactly like the sand and little rocks it encountered.  A few grains of sand slipped under the shutter button, making it difficult to take photos.  We were able to clean it out, but I must admit I thought the camera was done for.  Moral of the story, do not stick this in the sand.- Photo quality. It's not perfect.  But hey, it's only $100-$150 and it's a water proof camera! What more do you want.  I found that for taking normal photos (around the house or anywhere else on land), it's not the greatest camera. The photo's can appear a little hazy, especially with poor light. HOWEVER, in the water, this camera takes pretty good photos.I have not had any issues with moisture in the camera.  Then again, I live in a very dry climate and I don't usually leave it submerged in the water.  I will occasionally dunk it in the water or swim around with it for a few minutes, but for the most part, I treat it as a water resistant camera rather than a camera made for diving.This is a perfect camera for the family pool.

Reviews.Title: Video issues,Great Pictures.
Reviews.Author: Random person
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a holiday and I have been shooting great pictures with this camera. I use the Flash for my pics and it looks amazing. How ever, the video will not focus when I try to record it really stinks I would only buy this if you want Great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Works great until water gets in
Reviews.Author: Paul Wright
Reviews.Content: As a standard camera, I was disappointed in the lag time between when the shutter button is pressed and when the picture is taken. This camera is as slow as the ones from 5 years ago. As a waterproof camera it worked great for several trips to the lake and a few trips to the ocean. But eventually water got into it and now it will not work at all any more. Its been more than a year since I bought it, but its only been underwater maybe 20 times. I wouldn't say don't buy one, because the underwater pictures I got while it worked were great to have, but it seems as if the battery compartment just doesn't seal well enough to keep the water out. I never went deeper than 10'. The only thing I might have done wrong is jump into the water while holding it.

Reviews.Title: I'm in love with this camera!
Reviews.Author: Coral Costal "KVC"
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera. This is just so amazing. It has such great quality photos! I have some pictures of a lizard I have, and you can see my friends fingerprints in all of them! The underwater photos aren't bad at all, and the size it HUGE, but you can adjust that in the camera settings easily.The only thing I don't like is the opening hatch, it's a bit of a pain at first. But for the price, if that's all I have to complain about, it's nothing!I definitely would recommend this camera to anyone who wants a great camera, with the plus of being waterproof.

Reviews.Title: Foggy Screen
Reviews.Author: Kelli Powers
Reviews.Content: I got this as a gift from my husband and kids for my birthday. We took in on family vacation. Every day we took it in the pool and every day the screen developed dots and then became very foggy. Picture and video quality suffered. My sister in law has the same camera, that is why I chose this one. She loves it. Although listed as the same model # the blue and black camera looked different. The buttons were different too. I don't know if it was just bad luck or if you should AVOID the Blue model.

Reviews.Title: good camera for basic pictures
Reviews.Author: hawaiigirl21
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a year ago, and it still works great! It is really durable, completely waterproof, sufficient battery life, GREAT video quality, and fun to use. The only thing is that the pics come put blurry and the quality is poor

Reviews.Title: Great Little Point and Shoot!
Reviews.Author: jefwilli
Reviews.Content: Didn't purchase on Amazon; received it as a Birthday gift.  So far it's been a great little point and shoot.  The picture quality is great.  The only thing about the video so far on  the negative size is that you can hear the internal zoom on the audio track.  Video quality is much better than I expected from this camera and a great bonus.  When using it in the water, droplets on the lens can ruin a great shot.  It can be challenging to see what you're shooting in bright lighting situations like out in the water.  Still the fact that this camera is waterproof tips the fun balance in its favor.  For most shooting situations, this camera does a brilliant job and I strill haven't begun to scratch the surface of all its features! I'd give it five stars, but I'm holding one back to give it some time in case it lets me down.

Reviews.Title: fine pix
Reviews.Author: grape ape
Reviews.Content: I've only had it for four weeks but it's working great so far got some great underwater shots at my friends pool party!!

Reviews.Title: fuji cameras are horrible
Reviews.Author: L. Madej "LUKI TECH."
Reviews.Content: i bougth this for my snorkling trip in mexico... For the first two days it held up good and the paint came off ( after each use in salt water i would rinse and submerge this camera in fresh water like my 3 year old olympus)Also camera would fog up a lot... when i called fuji customer service (edison nj) go figure... they were not helpful they only offer to swap it out for a refurbished one i told them that this is new 4 day old camera...positive: good video, decent battery lifecons: customer service is the worst i have ever encountered, build cheap waste of moneyi decided to stay with my 3 year old olympus who has been on over 39 snorkling trips and counting.my advise is get the canon or olympus you can`t go wrong

Reviews.Title: Worked great once, but ...
Reviews.Author: hotdesert
Reviews.Content: Bought it for a beach vacation.  The first time I used snorkeling it the pictures were great, the video was great.  The next day it wouldn't turn on and that was that.  I thought maybe the battery compartment leaked, but the battery and the memory card were perfectly dry, however moisture was visible in the screen so it obviously leaked somewhere.  Never went below three feet under water with the camera.  Can't recommend it for use in or by water.

Reviews.Title: coolest camera!
Reviews.Author: yamuna
Reviews.Content: i love to use this camera. for the price i think its an awesome camera.i take it to the beach often, and it takes amazing pics in pools. glad i bought it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Waterproof Camera
Reviews.Author: JuneauSurvival
Reviews.Content: I love this camera because it does everything it's supposed to and it does so at a great price.  I live in Southeast Alaska and we get lots of rain here, which is one of the reasons why I bought this camera, and it has always performed great even when I've gone on rainy hikes.  I also happened to drop it in a stream once and it came out unscathed even after a couple minutes of submersion (don't ask how it got there though).The form factor on the camera is not bad and it's light enough that I can just carry it around in my hand as I'm hiking--just in case I see a good shot.  The only two quirks I find with it are that the shape of the camera can sometimes make it difficult to place it on top of stuff to take delayed pictures...but hey, that's why you take a friend on the hike, right!  The other thing which I found weird is that you can't take high resolution pictures with it.The pictures it takes are great though, and I am pretty happy with them, but it would be nice if I could take high-res ones since the camera can take high-res video, which by the way, is very high quality.  The high-res movies might eat up a lot of real state on the memory card, but they are certainly worth it.Overall I think this is a great camera with great features at a great price.  If you're a professional photographer or like to take super high quality pictures this might not be the camera for you.  But, if you like to take lots of pictures and expect to be in a wet environment this is certainly a great camera for the job!

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Army Wife and New Mom
Reviews.Content: It's a decent camera for the money.  The picture quality seems fine.  There's a lag (a couple of seconds?) between when you push the button to take the photo and when it actually 'snaps' the photo, so trying to capture my 14 month old sometimes gets a little frustrating.  She'll have her head turned or be on her way to something else when the camera actually gets the pic.  If your going to be taking photos of posed shots or landscapes, it's great, not so much for active subjects.

Reviews.Title: awesome for the price
Reviews.Author: J Kennedy "Ms Kennedy"
Reviews.Content: Not bad at all.  We enjoyed this camera on our honeymoon.  Snorkeling, waterfalls, and running around the cruise ship!  Great photos and nice short video clips.

Reviews.Title: Nothing it claims to be
Reviews.Author: SilverThunder
Reviews.Content: My husband is a kayak guide and bought this camera specifically for its waterproof abilities.  With one day of use, the battery compartment popped open, without being dropped, and saltwater completely ruined the camera.  We took it back to exchange it.  Got a new one.I took it out on a paddle in fresh water.  As I was climbing back into my kayak, it dropped from my lap and into the water.  No problem, its shock proof and water proof.  I felt around at the bottom and fished the camera out only to find that yet again the battery compartment of this new one had popped open.  Not only did water get into the camera, but the battery ejected itself and was now somewhere in the murk.  Luckily with a few more minutes of fumbling in the cold alaskan waters, I found it.  The camera fell at most 3 inches off of my lap into the the water then sank about 12 inches - this wouldn't even be enough of an impact to break a glass.  Shock proof NO, water proof NO.  I took it home and dried it out in rice.  Turns on and takes a picture but the lenses are shot!  Photo all blur, display all blur.I used this camera "with success" around water(without it completely breaking) previously and the photos developed a fog at the top range and wouldn't go away. It was okay if you were taking photos while on a hike, although the macro wasn't very sharp.  We didn't get too much time to fool around with it other than that because it broke too soon both times.A good price isn't good if it doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: Michelle Robinson
Reviews.Content: This Camera was brought out in the water 4 times and got water behind the screen. The pictures came out nice and it still works but you can really tell what you are shooting anymore after it leaks water. We will see how the warranty service pans out.

Reviews.Title: Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Collin Almquist "Collin"
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about buying this camera because of several bad reviews, but it's worked great for me!  We used it at Niagra Falls and the water park where it was submerged for hours on vacation.  The pictures were much better than anything you'd get from the disposable underwater cameras that other people were using.*This camera does not come with a flash card

Reviews.Title: A pretty darn good camera for lover of nature and good photos
Reviews.Author: Michigan Photo & Video
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera to replace, or at least substitute for my favorite Pentax Optio W30. I'd used that camera for years and was consistently impressed with its photo abilities. Its sharpness, color saturation and especially long exposure shots were all darn good. Really good. I'm a 20-year professional photojournalist and wedding photographer, so my eye is fairly well trained as to what to look for in camera capabilities - and the Pentax fit the bill. However, this is about the Fujifilm XP. I was attracted by its price, design, and positive reviews from those who seemed to know what they're talking about. My impressions, after three months of use, are below.First off, you'll notice that this Fuji is shaped a bit oddly. Like regular point-and-shoot was sort of squished in from the sides and top. It's almost got a pear-like shape - which I like. With this design, it fits well in the hand, even pretty big mitts like mine, and doesn't feel too tiny. Its screen is a little bigger than 2"x 1 1/2". That is a good sized screen and compares better than my Optio's.Like most point-and-shoot digitals, the Fuji gives you way too many options for settings. Programs for shooting portraits, programs for photographing pigeons in flight at night, and programs for shooting portraits in a farm field while back lit and tilted at an angle. You get the idea. There must be more than two dozen program settings you can choose from. Overload, but I guess it's better than just a few to choose from. I usually just leave the darn thing on "P" - basically automatic and am pleased with what it does.As for the images. Wow. They're good. Usually. Using the standard color calibration (there are four settings to choose from) I've almost always been pleased with what I've gotten. I take about 90% of my shots outside, under varying light situations (harsh daylight, soft cloud light, sunsets). However, I must note that from what I've seen so far, the Fuji XP doesn't handle highlights real well. If the camera chooses a mid-range exposure, and there are areas of the photo that have real bright light on them - well the Fuji treats them pretty harsh. I've noticed that most other cameras don't have problems with highlights, but so far, it's my only real complaint - and seeing that I basically got this camera for under $150, I'm not really worried about it.The only other slight complaint would be with the positioning/size of the camera's controls. I know Fuji had to pack a lot of stuff onto a 12 megapixel camera that's about 3 1/2 x 2 1/2", but the camera's power button is so tiny and difficult to punch on, that it's bound to frustrate more than one person. Also, the camera's rear control panel, that gives you access to the its programs, images, and delete functions are all clustered in a vertical strip on the right, encased in a waterproof little bubble thing that, again, if you've got man-sized digits, might be a little tough to navigate. But I have and can get around them, so it's not too bad a deal.As for it's waterproof-abilities. I really haven't had the thing too deep in water in order to adequately tell you what I think. I've had it about a foot below some fresh water, taking video of fish I've caught, and the videos look great and the camera stayed dry. These are good things! The real test is when I take it to the Florida Keys in awhile. The Optio's worked flawlessly there over the years, and hopefully this Fuji XP will be up to snuff as well.I wish I could post a link to some of the photos I've taken with this camera. I think you'd be impressed. If you take them at maximum quality (as I usually try to) you'll find really nice images that are about 3 megabytes uncompressed. Big, but not too big.

Reviews.Title: DONT BUY THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: disgruntled
Reviews.Content: I got 2 uses out of this camera before water damage. I know there are some mentally challenged people who probably dont close it correctly or change memory cards in/near water so they have to have that fineprint "no warranty for water damage disclaimer"  This was a one and done. Charged battery, used it one day, worked next day then died after third picture.Poor performance from a usually reliable manufacturer. Nice job Fuji, will never buy or recommend your product again

Reviews.Title: Disappointing camera
Reviews.Author: Computer User
Reviews.Content: I have several cameras and bought this one specifically for underwater photography.  I wanted it for snorkeling while on a Caribbean cruise, but I also used it for general photography on days when I could not take my other camera because I knew I was going to be snorkeling.  I could not recommend this camera for *any* purpose.  First, it is impossible to see anything either in bright sunlight or underwater.  I am aware of the problem of seeing images on the screen in bright sunshine, but this one is far worse than any other camera I have owned.  As someone else pointed out, it only makes a good mirror if you want to view your own image instead of the scene you are trying to film.  Both underwater (where it was really important to me) and otherwise, it was impossible to even see if the camera was turned on.  The little blue light was never visible underwater, so even that did not provide a clue.  As to picture quality:  very mixed results.  Some pictures were fairly good, but I get better pictures from other (even less expensive) cameras.  There were a number of pictures (above ground, not even underwater testing) where the images suddenly had a very deep purple or blue cast.  These were sometimes pictures taken from the same position and without changing any settings, but one picture would be fairly good and the next would be deep purple.Waste of money!

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: SixEighteen
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely stoked that I bought this item. We went to Disney World and were able to take pictures at the water parks! Had the camera in the water with me the whole time. Used Kodak/Energizer rechargeable batteries and used two sets all day. I can't say enough good things about the quality! I would love to provide pictures/video to the review.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for young active teen photos
Reviews.Author: Damaris
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for an active person that wants to capture the daily outdoor activities. The price is good for the camera quality and has the plus of the durability and waterproofing.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera great deal
Reviews.Author: Cookie
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a graduation present for my daughter.  She's been taking it with her every where since then.  She used it for the first time under water at the beach two weeks ago and the pictures came out very clear.  She had a blast and all of her friends wanted to have their picture taken under water.  She has already used the video, and this has also past the test.  The sound it too low though.  The regular pictures taken are good quality as well.  Its a good camera for a teen age girl.

Reviews.Title: Dead after 13 months
Reviews.Author: Joaquin Torrans "FCCanoeman"
Reviews.Content: Worked well until it stopped working. Batteries will charge but camera won't power up. Three splashpark and 6 canoe trips and that's all for the Fuji.

Reviews.Title: Value for Money
Reviews.Author: A. W. Guy
Reviews.Content: At $83.00 for a high resolution water resistant and dustproof camera it is great value for money. The on feature takes a while to come to shooting speed and the features are not idiot proof to use. You need to read the manual, but for a point and shoot camera for the beach, camping or for "on the water" its hard to beat at the price.

Reviews.Title: good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: vinoz
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on a trip in Australia so that I could take photos and video while snorkeling and diving. As I mainly used it underwater the photos were great. When I used it in the Galapagos later that year, I took some amazing close up shots of the wildlife, so good that I was asked if they were taken with my other camera - a G11. However, apart from those pictures the quality of the rest of the land shots were not as good.  Also, the buttons on the camera started to lose their protective film and stopped working correctly - they either wouldn't work at all, or would start to work when I thought I was pushing other buttons (I got a few random videos while trying to change settings) The camera's life ended when I was snorkeling the battery area popped open and flooded the camera. However, as it was still under warranty, I sent it to the Fujifilm in the US and they sent me back a brand new camera! I plan to keep using this camera until it dies too.

Reviews.Title: Save your money.
Reviews.Author: TCS
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera from Costco. After the 90 days the camera would not turn on. I informed Costco who referred me to the repair service for Fuji. I was informed that the battery door was cracked and had to pony up 54.00 to get my camera back. I did not receive "My" camera but rather a refurbished model.Extremly disappointed in the craftsmanship of this POS.

Reviews.Title: Takes A Beating
Reviews.Author: Firenrescue

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo23YXP4FNE9CWPcurrentClick) { return cv_mo23YXP4FNE9CWPcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:33 MinsThis camera has work great for me. I have dropped it in fire and ash, taken it under water. I keep the camera in a bag at work that gets tossed around allot. This camera has good battery life and preforms as advertised. Heres a short under water video that i took with it (the water quality was not good but you should get the point).

Reviews.Title: Sporty camera and resonable price
Reviews.Author: LO
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a camera that we could use with the kids in our outdoor activities.  So far this camera has been great, our 2 year old can't really damage it.

Reviews.Title: Good for an inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: M. Albert
Reviews.Content: This is a good value camera for the price.  It takes pretty good pictures, most of the time, and I suppose you could call it idiot-proof.  I am notoriously hard on small electronic devices like cameras, so this camera is perfect to throw in my purse, or in my backpack when going hiking, or take on vacation and not worry about what I might do to it.  I once dropped a camera in the sand in haleakala crater in Maui (an older Fuji finepix, and that one didn't break either, although I shook out sand for weeks).  I need a camera I can't easily break.Like I stated before, the Fuji Finepix XP10 Waterproof digital camera takes good pictures MOST OF THE TIME.  This camera struggles with low lighting or pictures taken in the dark (think fireworks, rock concerts -- wrong camera, this one can't handle it).  But take it to the beach, on your hike, your daytime boat trip, kids' birthday party, whatever...Good results with very little messing around with settings.I'd buy it again -- good value camera.  Just don't expect it to do everything perfectly ;)

Reviews.Title: Worked well
Reviews.Author: KingPing
Reviews.Content: Silver XP10 worked just as expected. Purchased for a cruise during which I snorkeled. It was underwater twice for 1 hour time periods and performed well. No water leakage. Pictures came out well enough, not as good as some other cameras, but certainly good enough especially for an underwater camera. Video quality very good, although you can clearly hear the camera zoom during video.Overall very pleased with camera and look forward to using in more water situations.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD
Reviews.Author: RAY
Reviews.Content: I BOUGHT THIS CAMERA TO TAKE ON A CRUISE-IT DID WHAT I EXPECTED A MAYBE A LITTLE MORE.UNDERWATER PICTURES WERE BEAUTIFUL.. NIGHT SCENE MODE WAS OK..

Reviews.Title: 2nd time i took this in the pool it got water damage
Reviews.Author: Christopher Sterman
Reviews.Content: 2nd time i took this in the pool it got water damageI hope they replace this, I bought it in aprill for my wife.other than that it semed great easy to use nice menueit got damage in about 3 feet of waterI'll change my reveiw if they actually replace thisI have had other under water cameras and they always last just finethis is very disapointing.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: LJ
Reviews.Content: Camera filled with water on the first use.  Yes, the battery cover was properly closed.  It was being properly used.  This is not the first waterproof camera I have owned.Fugifilm customer service did not return my request for a refund.

Reviews.Title: NOT SHOCKPROOF!!!!
Reviews.Author: lovestennis
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera from Amazon as a 2010 Christmas gift for our daughter.  As a college student she requires a 'hardy' camera that can withstand drops and bumps while being taken to the bars and toted around in the bottom of a purse or book bag.  She previously had the Olympus stylus "TOUGH" camera, and it was shockproof and waterproof and had survived several spring break trips and college parties.  (It was replaced with THIS camera after the olympus was stolen).  After having this new camera a VERY SHORT period of time it was accidentally dropped and it has not worked since.  The camera was still under a 'manufacturer' warranty but she did not have the time to deal with the hassle of mailing it in and waiting weeks etc.  I would NOT recommend this camera.  It didn't survive 6 months!

Reviews.Title: Ok for the low price
Reviews.Author: Plant Doctor "gpmsu"
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. For the price, the lowest for a waterproof camera, it's just barely OK. Negatives... lcd hard to see, pic quality is worse than a 5 year old, 3 megapixel camera, slow to shoot even after pre-focusing. For an inexpensive camera to use at the pool for casual pics, it's OK, but not at the same level as the Canon D10. I suspect this camera has too many pixels for the sensor size and the 5x vertical lens just doesn't have the optical quality. I wonder if this camera had 6 megapixels and a 3x lens if the pic quality would be better? Of course, these specs would be less exciting.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: Willis
Reviews.Content: I like everything about the camera except that you can zoom in on a picture you have already taken just to view it.  Also they sent me the wrong color but that has nothing to do with the camera itself.  overall it was  a great deal.  I have used it under water already as well and it worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera is, small, easy to use, takes good pictures. I bought a pentax before this one and ended giving it to my little sister because it would take blury pictures all the time. I won't be giving this one away.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: CC
Reviews.Content: I GOT THIS FOR MY DAUGHTER AND SHE LOVES IS ALOT.IT TAKES GREAT PICTURES AND IS VERY DURABLE

Reviews.Title: This is not a good camera
Reviews.Author: Michael T. Hatch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I thought we were doing something wrong, because we continually get low quality pictures with this camera. We aren't professional photographers by any means, but we can generally take simple pictures at family functions. With this camera, it takes a minimum of 3 tries to get anything that isn't blurry. Mind you, I'm taking pictures at my kids Easter pageant not high action photography. The rechargeable battery is a nice feature, however, if you are travelling overseas in a country with 220 voltage, then you will have to bring with you the charger plus a voltage converter or risk frying the camera. This camera is virtually unusable, in our opinion.After reading the reviews, I found a large number of people had the same problem, so I would strongly suggest to keep looking as this camera has the potential to be very disappointing. What good is a durable, waterproof camera if it takes terrible pictures?

Reviews.Title: Excellent waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: javierV
Reviews.Content: Lovely waterproof digital camera. We are use to using this camera everywhere and it works properly anytime. Now I'm fond of Fujifilm.

Reviews.Title: Great for Water Pics for Family Tough on Electronics
Reviews.Author: Jessica M. Skorupski "x"
Reviews.Content: Wanted a waterproof point and shoot camera for a family cruise vacation where we'd spend lots of time in the water and also had scheduled a "Swim with Dophin" excursion which we really wanted to capture on film. I couldn't have been more pleased with the results. The pictures taken in the water were fantastic. The camera is compact and sturdy. Even the green is fun!

Reviews.Title: Impressed by this economical camera
Reviews.Author: Lyndsey
Reviews.Content: I purchased my camera for $80 on sale for an upcoming trip to Mexico.  I brought it into the pool, snorkeling, ATVing, and spelunking.  It acted a little weird the last day, but it's worked fine again since.  This was really hardy and it allowed me to bring a camera around with me on my vacation that I didn't need to babysit.  Very impressed.  Next time, though, I'll be looking into a submersible camera case; not due so much to the design, but because I was too afraid to take it diving.  I prefer my Cannon for taking photos I really care about, as this camera is not good inside and doesn't take high quality photos.  But for the price, it performed well above my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Good camera but the software that came with it doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Tygur90 "tygur90"
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my wife -- as she has had a propensity to drop cameras occasionally.  We've gone through 3 cameras in 3 years as a result.  Haven't dropped this one yet, but am hoping the "shock proof" feature is accurate.  The camera is rather small and the finish is fairly slick -- so I could definitely see situations where it could get dropped, if you didn't have the strap around your wrist.The biggest problem we've had is we haven't been able to get the download software to work.  My wife runs Windows Vista and it keeps telling us that it needs updated, but it fails every time.  I'm gonna try to uninstall it altogether and try again.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Riley
Reviews.Content: This was our first underwater camera and we chose this one based on the other reviews, and the price was in our budget. We were blown away by the quality of the pictures, underwater and above. Once we got home we downloaded them on our computer and were even more pleased with it. On the cruise we had people stopping us and asking us about the camera because we had it in the pool and ocean. Another wonderful thing about this camera is the battery, it comes with a rechargeable battery. I was worried about the battery life, and it lasted a long time. Needless to say, We love it!!

Reviews.Title: Loved it but watch out around water...
Reviews.Author: Rach "The Mad Mezzo"
Reviews.Content: I loved this camera while I had it.  One thing that really bugged me was that when I turned the sound off so the buttons wouldn't beep, it also turned the flash off.  WHY these are linked together is beyond me.  I never like the buttons beeping and making noises, but the only way to do that was to turn off the flash as well.Also, the battery life is very short, and the camera easily turns on - wasting battery life.  On the plus side, it charges completely in about 1 hour.BUT, the big problem was the waterproofing.  We took the camera into the pool - FABULOUS pictures.  I loved it.  We then took the SD card out & uploaded the pictures.  The next day when I went to use the camera, it was completely dead and would not start.  The camera looked dry when we removed the SD card, but there must have been a drop of water somewhere that fried the system.  So, watch out!

Reviews.Title: paniolomike
Reviews.Author: paniolomike
Reviews.Content: great little camera however the seal on the door to the battery/SD card could be tighter, it always lets water in all around the lip and seal, so you must quickly dry it off or it run's into the chamber with the battery in it?i sent the first one back because of this and the next one had identical problem.i guess i should be asking if this is normal?

Reviews.Title: WOW What FUN!
Reviews.Author: Harry Mason
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. Now, that said, it can't compete in picture quality with my Canon SX200 IS, but the image is good and you can take photos in the water and under the water and have them come out great! I bought it for my wife, but when she wasn't using it, I was! I used it swimming, boogie boarding, snorkeling and splashing through the waves... what FUN!So, now I carry this and my Canon and never miss a shot.PS get the soft rubber cover to keep it from slipping out of your hand. The only bad part about the cover is it makes it a little harder to depress the shutter button.

Reviews.Title: want mine?
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get this camera, a "fun" camera to take in the pool, to the beach, theme parks, skiing, etc. and to save my Canon PowerShot (which I like) for "more controlled" (not wet, sandy, cold etc.) moments.  In the end, I'm largely disappointed.  The picture quality is just okay, *IF* the thing figures out how to focus on your subject.  I delete a good 20% of my photos that are *way* out of focus.  The flash recycle time is very lengthy... trying to get shots of kids at a birthday?  Forget it... you'll be holding the shutter down waiting and waiting for the flash from the last picture... moment long gone and you've got the shot of the backs of everyone's heads.  Oh, and the flash really washes everything out badly.  Video?  A total loss.  Well, more specifically the video itself is decent enough, but the audio ruins the day.  It's not just bad, it's unusable.  And there's something funky with mine, this 500ms on / 500ms off overwhelming humming noise, and no it's not the zoom... I'm guessing some electrical noise of some kind... maybe writing data to the flash card?  I talked to Fuji and they said it's because I didn't use the recommended flash card (I used a class 10 Patriot).  Possibly, but I've invested enough in this to know I don't want to invest more.  Canon, please update your D-series and maybe I'll give that a shot, and for goodness sake, where's the HD video?  The only positive to the Fuji is it wasn't expensive...

Reviews.Title: Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: Shari
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera right before we went on a cruise.  I read the reviews and saw some of the negative reviews and thought...those are just some of the review, there were some good ones too.  BUT, I was VERY disappointed on day 3 of our trip and it stopped working!  VERY disappointed!  We never did get it to work again.  So, like some of the other reviews, don't buy this!It worked fine on the water slides and when it was just splashed, but it stopped working when I put it in the water to get underwater pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a reasonable cost
Reviews.Author: dianne671
Reviews.Content: We used the camera on recent cruise.  It is wonderful for underwater shots, but in bright sunlight it is difficult to see the viewing screen.  Still the waterproof qualities make it great for vacations.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: dancingspam
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for less than a year, I don't even really use it to take pictures underwater, just in places where it may get splashed wet. Half way through my trip to Costa Rica water got inside the lens so all the pictures are completely blurry and unrecognizable. Definitely NOT waterproof don't buy

Reviews.Title: Not very waterproof .
Reviews.Author: jkp1848
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a vacation and within the first few days on and around the beach it no longer worked.  The pictures we had taken were lost.  The camera was never abused and it leaked on the second day.  The description said waterproof to ten feet, not even close.  It has been returned.

Reviews.Title: Water proof, I think not
Reviews.Author: Lisa Winnett "Vulture Lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera, because I live in Hawaii and wanted a camera to take with me to the beach and snorkeling.  I have only taken it to the beach a few times and it broke, I wasn't in more then 3 feet of water and it just stopped working. My advice don't buy this camera if you actually want to use it in the water. It will just break.

Reviews.Title: Just okay
Reviews.Author: jimminycricket
Reviews.Content: For a pocket sized underwater camera, it's revolutionary.  I like the styling and the way it fits in my hand.  The closure door for the battery is a little fragile but this operated very nicely on my shallow snorkeling trip.....no leaks.  As for indoor and general still outdoor shots it doesn't perform well.  Outdoor movies, it doesn't balance the light very well.  Overall it gets a B minus since the price is so reasonable and the fun factor right up there.

Reviews.Title: fujifilm waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: simplyblonde
Reviews.Content: I really like my new camera. I have even spilled margaritas on it and its still going strong.=) The way I go through cameras, the quality and features of this one is well needed! Plus the lime green is super cute!!!

Reviews.Title: good camera until the seal failed and water destroyed it
Reviews.Author: dcom
Reviews.Content: This was a good little camera that took nice pictures and video.The zoom motor is very loud, so video is best taken without zooming in.The camera worked until the gasket on the door failed after 3 underwater uses.The door got a small unnoticeable amount of play. The next water use destroyedthe display and buttons in seconds.I'll spend more money for a better camera.I liked the camera until it failed.

Reviews.Title: Decent pictures outdoors - terrible indoors
Reviews.Author: vt1991
Reviews.Content: I have now used this camera for about 5 months.The good:  It is very compact and sleek for a waterproof / shockproof camera.  Decent 720p video.  Waterproof feature is great.  I have used it a few times in the pool and actually went down a 3 story water slide with it.  Shockproof was tested with an accidental drop from about 4.5 feet on to tiled floor.  pictures outdoors are OK.The bad:  The picture quality indoors is terrible, especially under incandescent light.  It struggles to focus even in the simple center focus mode.  I have totally given up on the dynamic and face recognition modes.  Flash photos make the subjects too bright and the background is all black. Horrible red eyes on all of them  Zooming is very slow and yes the zooming sound does end up in the video.  Battery is horrible.  It won't last even about 25 pictures if you shoot with flash and face recognition and use about 10 minutes of  video.  Battery will indicate half full and within 5 pictures go completely dead.

Reviews.Title: You can't hear a plane fly overhead for the hiss on this camera
Reviews.Author: satanrobot
