Reviews.Title: Would recommend this camera.
Reviews.Author: Hope Schaaf
Reviews.Content: Took this camera to Aruba and got some great shots.  Was playing around with the settings and still have some adjusting but the underwater shots came out great.

Reviews.Title: Juan Rojas
Reviews.Author: Juan Rojas
Reviews.Content: Es una buena camara por el fabricante, en el caso mio, me llego con ciertos detalles, como la corneta para escuchar los videos. deben estar pendiente. por eso le doy 3 estrellas.

Reviews.Title: good water/shock proof small digicam for the price
Reviews.Author: Tech Walker
Reviews.Content: reasonable picture quality (good low light shooting) 5x optical zoom.ok 720p mjpeg video recording (you need more memory to hold the same length video compare to mp4, h264). You can change zoom while to video recording but auto focuslag is quite long (a few seconds).Not as greate as Sony TX5, but excellent for the price (less than half of TX5).

Reviews.Title: good when it works
Reviews.Author: caminochuck
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for 5 months and it is a nice camera when it works. The problem is when the battery gets charged the night before use, the camera sometimes doesn't work the next day. After this happened four times I sent it back to get it checked and nothing was found wrong. They gave me a different charger thinking that was the problem but it wasn't.If your pictures aren't important than this is a good camera.If you need a reliable camera don't buy it.

Reviews.Title: Great gift- she loved it!
Reviews.Author: jillian.marie7
Reviews.Content: My friend has this camera and loves it, so I got it for my mom for Christmas.It's easy to use and has all the qualities so I know she can't break it- waterproof, shockproof, freezeproof, etc.

Reviews.Title: poor quality camera
Reviews.Author: pablo ramirez
Reviews.Content: i used it for about 5 times (3 at the beach). i was on vacations at Rio de Janeiro, taking pictures on the beach, and it simply stopped working.

Reviews.Title: a Grand camera for some Grand turk pictures!
Reviews.Author: bargain shopper
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I am a Canon camera junkie...in our household, we own 4 of them. My 'regular use' camera is a 200IS, but when we decided to take our teens on a cruise this year, I KNEW I would need an underwater camera that had a low price point, yet some decent features. The Fuji seemed to fit the bill, and reviews were mixed.Got this camera about a month before cruise time, and of course I tested it out right away. Indoor pictures are AWFUL..worse than awful, they are horrible. BUT I had my Canon for that anyway. The first time underwater (hubby's fishtank).. I discovered that I hadn't sealed the battery compartment properly. Fortunately, there was only a rim of water around the seal..if you decide to purchase this camera, use extra caution when making sure the battery/camera card door is FIRMLY slid into place. One 'detractor' is the fact that there is no 'wrong way' to put in the battery..until you try to turn on the camera and find it won't turn on. Oops. Battery life is 'okay'..but I purchased two extra just in case. We did very well and easily got through our day on the beach with a single battery. We also purchased a floating strap from a different vendor..a wise investment, believe me!We used this camera in Grand Turk and La Romana and got some great pictures as well as great video both under water, and in. Matter of fact, my teens facebook picture of her under the deep blue sea is a testament to the quality of the photos. Beach photos are bright,clear and crisp. [...]

Reviews.Title: Good for my wife's purse and around the pool
Reviews.Author: NEguy
Reviews.Content: We use this camera when my expensive Canon is not appropriate - such as around the pool, at the beach, etc. and when it's just nice to have a small camera to tuck in a purse or shirt pocket.Photo quality is "good enough" - if I really need a better image, I use my Canon.  I figure this will get shots I would normally pass on given the environment and conditions.My wife is the primary user, so the small FF and small buttons don't bother her.  She also can deal with the lack of a viewfinder, which I am conditioned to use.  Every single time I pick up the camera, I try to look through the non-existent viewfinder!The only nit (so far) is that I cannot find a way to get the replacement sealing gasket mentioned in the manual.  Fuji suggests changing it annually to maintain its waterproof capability.  The manual goes on to say "at cost" and contact the place where you purchased or Fuji repair. Figuring Amazon did not have the gasket, I called (and emailed) Fuji.  Responses were identical; send the unit in for "repair."  I told them I just need the gasket (per the manual) and was not going to incur the shipping and repair costs for a $.50 rubber gasket that THEY recommend I replace.  I see this as a battle that will be fought for several months.  I can see a situation where I don't replace the gasket, the camera leaks, I send it in, and Fuji says "if you had replaced the gasket, it wouldn't have leaked."If you own this camera and know how to get a new gasket (happy to pay for the part), please post something here for the rest of us (and Fuji).

Reviews.Title: Would only use as a second camera
Reviews.Author: Caleb Lamz
Reviews.Content: We have two little boys and thought a tough, waterproof camera would be really useful.  I also liked the fact this camera took HD video.  We have taken pictures in all types of situations - indoors, outdoors, fast motion, landscapes, you name it.  After using it for about 2 months, we are very disappointed. The quality of the pictures is simply poor.  Unless you are in perfect lighting, the pictures end up either blurry, overexposed, or grainy.  For the price of this camera, I wasn't expecting much, but I would venture to guess that over half of our pictures have some type of issue.  I know the camera is not defective, because there are some pictures that come out fine. We're not camera novices, either.  I've used digital cameras for over 10 years and understand how to adjust the settings.The people that claim this camera takes great pictures either were lucky enough to have taken them in excellent lighting, or they are comparing it to a digital camera they bought 10 years ago.  We are comparing it to a Canon SD1000 that was about 3 years old.  That camera was nothing special, but the picture quality was far better than this Fuji.The waterproof and toughness features of this camera are great, but the poor image quality doesn't make it worth it.  This would make a great second camera to use when you are going to be around water, but that's about it.

Reviews.Title: crap
Reviews.Author: meals
Reviews.Content: well, dont drop the thing. the zoom is now broken and before that the screen got a big black spot in it. i am not impressed with this camara. it does seem to be waterproof at least.

Reviews.Title: Fuji XP10
Reviews.Author: E. Kinney
Reviews.Content: I have taken some nice pictures with this camera.  Surprising, because I cant see a thing on the LCD screen when I'm outdoors.  It's always a pure guess, and I've learned to stand very still until I'm positive the camera is finished doing it's thing.  The on/off button is hard to operate.  Response time is slow, slow, slow - with every function, including reviewing and deleting pictures, which is most irritating.  I don't like the computer software at all, and it over-rides my Canon software, which I do like. (The Fuji software starts, when I plug in my Canon, which is over-ridable but a pain).  Battery life is about 3 hours/200 pictures, which isn't great, but a little better than my Canon.  I took this camera down the river in a kayak, and it stood up to the splashing.  I have not and will not purposely dunk this camera in water.  I DO like this camera at work, where I take a lot of technical pictures, indoors, with wet hands and environment.  I have quality photographs from this camera, especially when I can see what I'm shooting at.  I haven't dropped it yet, but it does appear to be quite rugged, which I like.  I took one video of the TV, and that seemed okay.  All in all, I'm glad I bought this camera - ONLY because it was a cheap way for me to experiment with a 5X zoom, and I really do need something waterproof for work.  My biggest complaint is not being able to see what I'm shooting through the LCD.  I can't imagine using it this winter in the snow, as the brighter the atmosphere, the harder it is to see anything.  That for me takes the fun out of photography.  I just can't figure what Fuji is thinking.  Nope, I wouldn't recommend this one, unless you are using it indoors like I've described.  I imagine my next camera will be another Canon.

Reviews.Title: Built for outdoor use
Reviews.Author: GB
Reviews.Content: The camera is great on outdoor takes. With sunlight and open spaces, pictures look great. For indoor use, pictures look kind of "sepia", it does not get indoor ilumination that good. Video is good on standart resolution; shooting on HD quality produced a trembling image when the camera is moving, although it claims to have a stabilization feature. I 'm yet to try shooting on a class 6 SD card (mine is class 4), to see if the increased speed can solve this "shaking video" problem on HD resolution. Audio gets ambient sound and the shooter voice, but almost nothing of other people's voices. There's a problem with the mike: it's placed right where it's intuitive for you to hold the camera, so you have to get used to hold the camera on a not-so-natural way in order not to cover the mike. The waterproofing is great, I've taken the camera on a fishing trip and it took some baths in muddy water, droppped on sand and other stuff like that, and no problem at all. It takes SDHC cards (faster than regular SD cards) up to 16GB, wich is more than enough for me (holds approx. 2500 photos at 12MP resolution, or 1h HD video, splited on 12 min chunks - it's a restriction on the max file size the camera can hold, wich I believe it holds for most cameras). Battery is ok, and it is replaceable, which is important, as you can buy another one to take with you on the camera case. The battery recharger is bi-volt, important on overseas trips. My overall impression is that it's a great buy for outdoor activities, considering the price. As I bought it to take on my fishing trips and to take to water parks/beach with the kids, I'm very satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: kid proof?
Reviews.Author: art  teacher
Reviews.Content: I bought 6 of these for students to use in a photoshop class. They are good "kid proof" cameras. The only drawback is that the USB is inside the battery/SD card compartment. With it being a waterproof camera I can see this as a necessity. I teach in the northwest with lots of rain so the waterproof feature is good. I don't plan on going under water with them  but with studen t sue this is a good feature. So far they work great.

Reviews.Title: All wet down under
Reviews.Author: twice61
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a trip snorkeling the great barrier reef in Australia. I double checked the battery/mem card door because of some reviews I had read said that water got in and ruined their pics. I guess I should have taken heed. I got a couple of pictures when testing above water and all seemed ok. The minute I hit the water---game over. I will return this camera and get my money back but the disappointment remains. DONT BUY THIS CAMERA

Reviews.Title: Worked and looks great but...
Reviews.Author: R. Wells
Reviews.Content: This product worked great but it malfunctioned within 30 days of buying it. Zoom error. I sent it in for repair and am waiting to hear what's wrong. Repair service is very professional though.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: mctrish
Reviews.Content: This is a great underwater camera! We took it to Mexico for a 2 week snorkeling trip and love how the pictures turned out. The video is touchy - need to make sure you move slow or it looks jerky. We even used it in our pond (dipping it underwater) and the pictures came out great. I'm impressed with the quality compared to price!

Reviews.Title: Perfect vacation camera!
Reviews.Author: ACL "ACL"
Reviews.Content: This little camera exceeded our expectations.  We had so much fun in Puerto Rico bringing the XP 10 right into the waterfalls and underwater for snorkeling!  Picture quality is above average for a compact waterproof camera.  I took it out surfing too with no problems.  The quick video mode is a great addition to this little gem.  The shape is a little funky to hold and the access door for taking pictures off of the camera is a little flimsy but other than that, we've been really happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great practical camera
Reviews.Author: Hugo Vadillo "Hugo Vadillo"
Reviews.Content: I bought this new(Fujifilm FinePix XP10 12 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver) because I didn't want to take my big lumix camera to my vacation. I figured it's waterproof and more practical, ideal for Bahamas. I'm very very happy with the picture and video quality I took. I went crazy taking pictures/videos in the rides and under water. For $149. I think it's a good deal. I put a usb strap in the camera to hang it more comfortable around my neck. To turn the camera on, you have to hold the on/off bottom for about 2 to 3 seconds. So far no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Tough little camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Marilyn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera when we were planning a trip to kayak and snorkle in the ocean. We took pictures both in and out of the water and it did stay water tight. I also wanted a camera that would be a little tougher and would not suffer if dropped or mis-used. The pictures aren't near up to the quality of my canon elf 7 MP but it serves the purpose well! It takes great pictuers in good light. Just remember that water spots do show up in pictures! It is a good idea to dry the lens when you take it out of the water!

Reviews.Title: Good Pictures Awful video sound
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shopper
Reviews.Content: If it wasn't for the sound in video mode, this little camera would be a great value.The quality of the pictures and even the video are amazing for a camera in this price range.If you add the waterproof features, it would be a no brainer. However, I bought the camera for my daughter so she could show her singing talent on Youtube.The microphone is located next to the zoom mechanism and during video recording the motorized zoom noise is recorded. It is not noticeable until you play it back in full glory on TV and you hear the annoying noise of the zoom.If your main goal is to use it for the underwater features, then I think it is a nice unit. Otherwise, try the Kodak Sport.

Reviews.Title: disappointed purchaser
Reviews.Author: kr
Reviews.Content: After using the camera for 6 days it started to malfunction.  When turning on it would go directly to video mode.  Then it would start turning itself on.  Took the battery out and the video card hoping to reset the camera, but unfortunately that did not work.  I am completely disappointed. Other than this freak happening the camera worked well the days prior.

Reviews.Title: Fuji review
Reviews.Author: S. Lynch "xrayquilter"
Reviews.Content: So far, this camera is everything I was expecting! I love how portable it is. It just slips in my pocket or purse & off I go! I have been pleased with the picture quality.

Reviews.Title: A Great Camera For When You Plan On Getting Wet
Reviews.Author: Jerry Glonek
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure I've ever written a review on Amazon before, but I felt compelled to write one about this camera for some reason - so here it is!There are a lot of complaints out there that the camera doesn't take the greatest photos, that it pales in comparison to other digital cameras. My response to those people are - so what? I own a high-end Canon PowerShot SX210IS camera and my fiancé owns a Canon Rebel XT SLR. Those are our cameras for taking the 'good' photos. The XP10 is for taking photos in places where I wouldn't want my $300, or her $600 camera, to be. Specifically - near water!This camera was great when we brought it to the beach last month, and plan to again soon. I could bring it out and take photos and videos wherever I wanted, without worrying that my hands were wet or sandy. That alone made the camera worth the purchase. It let me get the shots I wanted without having to compromise anything because of fear of getting a camera wet and breaking it.I even took this camera into the ocean with me, in the waves, and had some fun. Photos above and below the water (never, ever, take photos below the water in NJ, ew). Videos of the waves crashing into me. The only fear I had during this was the camera strap not holding on tight (it is pretty flimsy). I actually just solved this by buying a strap from Nintendo's website usually used for their Wii Remotes for $1 + shipping. Can't go wrong there!My only concern with the camera is the battery compartment. It's a normal flimsy battery compartment and I really hope it doesn't break because that will be the end of the waterproof part. Not sure what can be done to make that more sturdy.As for quality? My photos look absolutely fine, for what I was trying to take pictures of. Family, friends, sand and water on a bright day. Would I use this camera for other occasions? Maybe. But I do have my other cameras for that, but this would be a great backup.So in short - if you are looking for a camera that can survive the ocean, sand, and pools and that just happens to be able to take pretty good photos AND HD video - this is great. Let's not forget it's cheap and durable as well!If you are looking for a digital camera that can take amazing photos and videos and just happens to be able to survive water - well, don't complain when this camera isn't what you expected it to be. It is a waterproof camera first and foremost, and does that job great.

Reviews.Title: Great for the Outdoors
Reviews.Author: MJB
Reviews.Content: Love the camera.  Easy to use.  I took it on a rafting trip down the Colorado river and it was so much fun being able to take pic and not even worrying about getting it wet.  So Glad I bought it.

Reviews.Title: Small, cute
Reviews.Author: S. Ogle
Reviews.Content: We got this camera because our others had died and since we knew our next destination was the beach, we decided to try this one.  I really like it!  It is small and lightweight and takes good pictures.  The zoom is good for this size of camera.  We got to see a sea turtle nest hatching while on vacation but none of the pictures of it turned out using the night setting on the camera.  We are unsure if this is in issue with the camera or the fact that we were only allowed to use red lit flashlights.

Reviews.Title: Take me to the beach!!
Reviews.Author: Fantastic 7
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a back-up to my DSLR.  It needs serviced, & I can't be without a camera!  I really wanted a waterproof one, as my kids love to swim & I love to take photos.  This little camera is perfect!  The picture quality is nowhere near that of my DSLR, but if I didn't have that, I probably wouldn't know the difference.  I have a stand-alone video camera, so the video this takes isn't my main one, but it's great for those times where I don't have the other with me, or I'm somewhere I wouldn't take it, like the beach!!  I chose this Fuji over the Kodak PlaySport.  I was looking for a small point & shoot camera with video capability. The Kodak is a video camera that can take stills.  I did purchase a float strap later, which just gives me peace of mind as we are swimming.  I haven't actually been in water too deep for the camera or in a river where it could get away, but I plan on taking it whitewater rafting next summer.  I've been very happy with my purchase.  If you're looking for a good waterproof camera that takes decent photos in a super small package, Fujifilm FinePix XP10 is your camera!Fujifilm FinePix XP10 12 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Green)

Reviews.Title: Great camera to have...
Reviews.Author: Rajin Cajun
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera as a gift for my wife to use on vacation.  She loved it. Great for the outdoor's.  Camera is really easy to use.  Some people complained that the compartment that houses battery/memory card is hard to access but neither me nor my wife have any problem opening it.  Great for the Beach/Pool.  Underwater pictures/video's are really cool!  All in all a great camera to have for the outdoors.  Reason for the 4-star rating is there is no cover for the camera's lens from accidental scratches.  That is why I do suggest buying the XP10 Accessory Kit with camera for protection.

Reviews.Title: The best Camera ever
Reviews.Author: Dawn Pinder
Reviews.Content: Well I have ordered the XP10 12 MP but this review is about the older version the XP10 10MP.  That camera was amazing and the clarity of the picture were outstanding. I accidentally dropped it down on some rock and it isn't taking picture anymore.  I truly recommend either camera.It is not pricey, the underwater scenes are excellent, the video is great.  I can't say one bad thing about the camera.  Can't wait to get my new one in.....

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix XP10
Reviews.Author: KHuff
Reviews.Content: Everything on the camera has worked great, it took good pictures both on land and in water. Very durable, I took it through the mud without a problem. The only problem that I did have was not with the camera itself but with the battery charger that stopped working after one week.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT! Buying another one for myself...
Reviews.Author: Davd Luke Padgett ""Dance Naked & Wiggle ...
Reviews.Content: We received this camera as a gift for our beach vacation along with all the other families with my husband's company. (We already owned a similar Canon waterproof camera.) My 15 year old daughter took this one over from day one! She & the other teenagers did EVERYTHING with this camera. They dove off cliffs into the ocean, took it snorkeling, played in the pool, etc.  The pics turned out great. The size, waterproofing & shock proofing were incredible.  I am now having to buy another one for myself. The Canon version is $299, so this is a steal! Plus, it has more megapixels & zoom!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera for outdoor adventures!
Reviews.Author: Viviana1105
Reviews.Content: We got this camera for out recent trip to Hawaii and it was a great value for the price. We were able to bring it everywhere, hiking, snorkling, beach, and not worry about a thing. it took amazing pictures in the water which allowed us to get some awesome impromptu pictures with sea turtles and the quality is just amazing.The only gripes I have with this camera, is that the buttons arent great. You really have to press around to get them to work. Its also not the best camera for those self shots, we had to use a diffrent camera to get those. The float strap for the water made it very easy to carry around.This camera was a must have and added a whole lot to our vacation!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera !!!
Reviews.Author: Ruth
Reviews.Content: Addicted to Fuji cameras. This is a great camera. The only negative is that do not comes with a RCA cable to view my pictures on the TV.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof - amazing
Reviews.Author: Dr. Stuart Gitlow
Reviews.Content: My primary camera is a Canon SLR. I'm old school this way. I like to hold the camera up to my face, look through an optical viewfinder, and even focus manually at times before taking a photograph. But there are times when I want to take photos in the rain, or at the beach, or at a water park, or on vacation where I can't be bothered carrying around a heavy SLR and extra lenses. So at those times, I often find myself with only my cellphone camera, which hardly takes quality photographs.The Fujifilm FinePix XP10 has some incredible benefits over the big SLR's. The major selling point - it can get wet, and not simply damp from a few raindrops, but rather falling-into-the-pool wet with no damage whatsoever. My iPhone can't get wet. And my Canon sure can't get wet. So this is a big deal even without having any interest in underwater photography. Next up - bang-proof. Perfect. I handed it over to my 6 year old to test it out. He played with it for a day, outside, inside, with friends...took over 100 photos. All at his 6 year old height, which actually brought out some pretty interesting photos. He dropped it, banged it against something when he didn't have a hammer at hand, and quickly learned how to both shoot and review photos. At the end of the day, he returned the camera with no evidence whatsoever that he had ever touched it. So it passes the 6-year-old-boy test. So the camera is perfect for the waterpark, the beach, and it weighs nothing so you can put it in your front pants pocket or even your shirt pocket without the weight being an issue.There are tradeoffs, of course. The lens is fairly small, so while the software is excellent with a 12MP resolution, you shouldn't expect the equivalent of what you'd get with 12MP in an older Canon Digital Rebel. What you'll miss is the absolute crystal clarity of the larger lenses. But you'll certainly get a photo that you can blow up to 8x10 should you desire without difficulty. It's a bit difficult to hold the camera perfectly steady to take a photo, and I find it hard, without bringing it to my eye, to line it up so that it is parallel with my subject and perpendicular to the ground. It may be that this lack of steadiness is what has caused my photos to be less sharp than I'm used to as I'm finding that the photos have improved with time and understanding of the product. The battery is also quite small, and battery life can go quickly particularly if you're using this as a video camera. But then the battery charges quickly and the charger is small and portable. Charge it up each night, like your cellphone, and you'll be fine.I had no difficulty connecting the camera to my Mac computer and getting all the photos into iPhoto without any software installation. Note that the USB port in the camera is an unusual micro-variety, so don't lose the included cord or forget to bring it with you on a trip. I think the FujiFilm is precisely as promoted...a wonderfully portable camera with a wide variety of potential applications for both still and video photography, all at a reasonable price. Considering that not that many years ago we were looking at Kodak Instamatics as the only potential beach camera, we've really come forward a long long way.Addendum: one year later. The camera still takes nice photos and the battery still works. It's never been dropped, but the little door at the bottom that seals out water and hides the battery and USB port no longer latches closed. Instead it just hangs open. Obviously, the camera is no longer waterproof and the little door has to be held closed with tape to keep it out of the way. It looks like the plastic design for the door latch has tolerances that are just too fine -- the loss of even a small amount of plastic prevents the door from working anymore. It's too bad -- nice camera but poor design of the battery door.Addendum: two years later. I was able to remove the door and carefully bend the appropriate sections of it back into line. It works again, and the unit is again waterproof. The camera continues to work nicely and the original battery is holding up well.

Reviews.Title: Pictures are Terrible
Reviews.Author: Frederick W. White "stealthy327"
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I was excited to receive this camera but was soon let down....the picture quality is terrible. I'm not a professional photographer I just like clean pictures. If you take a picture inside with this camera there will be a lot of grain. Outside pictures were okay at best but not worth the money. I'm going with a normal point and shoot and purchase a waterproof case for it.

Reviews.Title: great for the price
Reviews.Author: cathy j terhune
Reviews.Content: So far we are very happy with this camera. The picture quality is great and it was the only camera under 200 dollars that wasn'tflimsy or poorly put together.. We don't plan to use it under water much but for here in Washington state we need rain resistant so it should be perfect. Videos are fine and as I stated the picture was great. Did a lot of research and for a cheaper camera this is the one to buy if you need water resistance or underwater use as a feature.

Reviews.Title: Fine, maybe not great
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Good for the cost. Simple to use, not hard to open, connect, download, etc. Haven't tried underwater video yet. Kinda slow shutter otherwise good compact camera.Had it for a while and it's a trooper, dropped many times etc... and it's still snapping Works well and downloads easily, I like it.

Reviews.Title: Great For The Water
Reviews.Author: Michael Alexander "greenacres"
Reviews.Content: I took this camera with me on vacation. We had a blast with in the pool and on the beach. Did not have to worry about it getting wet or damp. We used it in the rain as well and the pictures came out great. the photos in the water was good as well. But when it came to the fireworks at night the photos did not come out right. they was blurry. that was the only thing wrong with the camera. I like that its targets the faces, I minus 2 stars for the night photos because none of them came out. but daylight and fun in the pool good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures and film underwater
Reviews.Author: Tole Painter
Reviews.Content: I bought this in June for my son who is an avid fly fisherman and he has taken photos under water and also video taped fish under water and the pictures and video are great.  The video of the fish are real cool.  The underwater video and both regular and underwater pictures are sharp and he loves the camera.  We haven't gotten any of the photos printed yet, but he is, so far, quite happy with the camera.  The only think I was disappointed with was that I could not tell from the information on the product if there was a camera case included or not.  I called Amazon and they were not sure either.  I thought Fuji should have included a case.

Reviews.Title: Meh...
Reviews.Author: LaAngler
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to carry with me while fishing. I do a lot of wading so I opted for a water/shock proof since that's what killed my last pocket cam.My complaints are as follows:The data cable port is located too close to the hinge of the battery/card bay. Battery is very small. The user manual says to send the camera in after one year to change seals to retain the waterproof rating.Now I can live with all of the above, but the picture quality just isn't there. I didn't expect this thing to mimic a high dollar SLR, but even when comparing the images to my 2 year old camera (cybershot) the image quality doesn't come close.I am going to send this one back and try again. charge it to the game :P

Reviews.Title: Great for Price!
Reviews.Author: Baby Turtle "long-haired hippie"
Reviews.Content: Lots of nice features at a great price. I bought this for frequent cruises, waterparks and beaches. Any place I'm afraid to take my Cannon. This won't replace my Cannon but it's great for what it was meant for. I always buy the disposable waterproof cameras when vacationing and I figured this camera would pay for itself at this price.

Reviews.Title: Must have on a cruise or at the beach
Reviews.Author: T. Stewart "sunny cruise"
Reviews.Content: Took it on a island cruise and Florida Keys.  3 times in salt water and 3 times in the pool.  Another guy at our table took his snorkeling.  Fuji says max depth is 10 feet. I likely only went 4 - 6  feet. Took underwater and shot still and video.  A floating wrist strap is a must. Seal is an annual change.Image quality ok.  Back lit shots washed out.  5x zoom and 12 megapixels allow to zoom in on screen for cropping.  Battery goes up to 300 stills but video burns it up fast. Keep charger ready.Hard to see screen in bright light. My internal clock kept messing up resulting in the pics downloading out of sequence.  I returned the unit for this reason but may get another.It is small, light, tough, and underwater - Dude!

Reviews.Title: Zoom is broken
Reviews.Author: xxxxxxx
Reviews.Content: I bought it brand new for $40 off on Friday. The zoom in and zoom out buttons (W and T) beep when I press them but 29 out of 30 times nothing else happens.  1 out of 30 times, the camera will zoom in regardless of whether I pressed W or T.  Nothing makes it zoom out.  It has to be turned off so the zoom resets.  Searching the Internets found plenty of complaining about FujiFilm camera zooms for other models. I guess the XP10 can't zoom either. There are no firmware updates on FujiFilm's website. I contacted the company and they told me to mail the thing to New Jersey at my own expense so they could look at it.  Like that is gonna happen. This thing is going back to the store pronto.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Digital camera
Reviews.Author: Paolo Ravera
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this item. This was a present for my son's birthday. He likes the color and the item itself

Reviews.Title: NOT Waterproof. Stay Away!!
Reviews.Author: Ed Cullen
Reviews.Content: There is no reason to buy this camera. If your buying it for the waterproofing or other functionality, then stay away because it does not perform as advertised. I brought it to the beach 2 times. It broke the 2nd time with water leaking in through the battery compartment. It was not even underwater when it broke. In addition, sand kept getting between the shutter release button so that you cannot take pictures. I had to swash it around underwater to release the sand. I read the reviews of others before buying and hoped they were wrong, but they cant be any more accurate. Your better off buying a disposable waterproof camera for the price that is lost on this camera.If your buying it as a point&shoot; camera, then your looking at the wrong camera. The picture quality is bad at best. Your better off buying a cheap Canon point&shoot.;

Reviews.Title: NOT WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: Jennie
Reviews.Content: Do not buy! We bought this camera to take on our honeymoon to Bermuda. Our first day there we went to a beach and tried the camera underwater for the first time. It stopped working after about five minutes in a foot or two of water. We got back to shore and opened the battery compartment and it was full of water. After about a day of drying out it would only turn on if you wedged something between the battery and the door to make the battery make better contact with the terminals, but the screen never came back to life. It took pictures but there was no way to change settings or see what you were taking pictures of.Quality of pictuers left something to be desired also, too bad you can't give negative stars.

Reviews.Title: NOT WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: Jennie
Reviews.Content: Do not buy! We bought this camera to take on our honeymoon to Bermuda. Our first day there we went to a beach and tried the camera underwater for the first time. It stopped working after about five minutes in a foot or two of water. We got back to shore and opened the battery compartment and it was full of water. After about a day of drying out it would only turn on if you wedged something between the battery and the door to make the battery make better contact with the terminals, but the screen never came back to life. It took pictures but there was no way to change settings or see what you were taking pictures of.Quality of pictuers left something to be desired also, too bad you can't give negative stars.

Reviews.Title: FujiFilm XP10
Reviews.Author: Judith L. Unger
Reviews.Content: I bought this specifically to allow me to take photos while snorkeling during our once a year vacation to Mexico.  It worked for the first 2 days.  The design is such that it proved very difficult to align photos.  Also, the lens is positioned so that fingers often get in the way.  However, the key failure appears to be waterproofing.  The camera completely failed to operate on the 3rd day.  I could not find water in the battery compartment, but tried drying everything & recharging the battery.  Nothing helped.  Another vacationer bought the same camera while in Mexico & had precisely the same experience, with the camera failing after 2 days.I returned the camera to Fiji for repair.  It took a week for the camera to reach Fuji, then another 3 weeks for Fuji to acknowledge receipt and another week for it to be shipped back to me.  I am disappointed with the camera & Fuji service.Fujifilm FinePix XP10 12 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Green)

Reviews.Title: Wish I hadn't broken our Canon Powershot
Reviews.Author: Kim Ostermyer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to replace our Canon Powershot A1100IS, which I had inadvertently dropped and had a camera to floor collision. Had I known the replacement was going to be of considerably less quality, I would have fixed the Delorian and gone back in time to prevent my clumsiness.Appearance: It's a sleek camera and it easily fits in any pocket. Very lightweight and seems to be pretty durable.Picture quality: Eh. Very hit or miss. One of the flaws of this camera is that there seems to a considerable delay with the shutter speed from the point of pushing the button to the point of capturing the image. We're talking like the delay of a second or so, which may not seem like much, but photographic terms it is. I have two little boys who move very quickly and so a quick image capture is rather important. I can tell you that with the Canon A1100, I was able to capture our oldest son playing with a water hose and the water drops in flight as he waved the hose around. We were also able to capture 3-4 pictures of him going down a single slide while playing the park. With the Fujifilm, you *might* be able to squeeze off 2 pics before the kiddo is off the slide and off to some other playground feature.I have taken a couple thousand pictures with the camera since buying it last August and, for its size and price, it does could get you by if you needed something cheap before buying a great camera. I have taken a few pictures with this camera that I can say were awesome. Unfortunately, and this is with most cameras this size, blowing up the picture to an 8x10 tends to reduce overall clarity. One needs to keep in mind that if you do plan on blowing pictures up, plan your shots so when you crop them, you won't have to sacrifice limbs or appendages to make the shot fit into pictures beyond the 4x6 size.While not a major selling point, I found the sepia filter to be very great with its range of tone and color. Very cool to snap photos of kids with the old-timey look.Two major issues for use:The Battery: It can and will go in backwards (not upside down) and is not a unique shape that insures proper installation without looking at it or putting it in hoping its in correctly. The life of the battery is decent, but moderate use seems to require quite a bit of time on the charger. It is also a unique camera battery and does not offer the flexibility that a point and shoot camera should have. A more reasonable design would have put two AA batteries as the power source instead of a battery that requires a wall charger. I find this to be an annoyance as I'm not always going to somewhere with my camera where I can plug it in--but I am more than likely able to pickup a few AA batteries at a local gas station if nothing else.Another issue with this camera is that occasionally it freezes when reviewing the pictures. Upon pressing the button, it will show the most recent picture and will freeze on that picture. Removing the battery and putting it back in fails to correct this.Something that I like about the Canon A1100 was that the lens retracted when not in use. There was never any concern about whether or not carrying the camera in the same pocket with my keys would lead to scratches on the glass. With the Fujifilm, I'm constantly making sure that it is in a pocket free of anything that might scratch the glass covering the lens. While the body is pretty sound (haven't used it under water yet), I'm constantly concerned over scratches.I would recommend this camera as maybe a starter camera for the grandchild or maybe a scorned lover. But if you want a camera with more bang for your buck, get the Canon A1100. It's a bit more, but it was a great camera and I am still kicking myself for dropping it.

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE
Reviews.Author: Ryan Cavanaugh
Reviews.Content: I was so excited about this camera.  We were going on a cruise so I was really looking forward to testing out the waterproof feature for snorkeling in Mexico.  I had the camera for a few days and took a couple of test shots which came out...okay.  It took some effort to adjust the flash settings in order to get the right one.  I had taken about 10 pictures when the camera screen said "ZOOM ERROR" and wouldn't take any pictures.  I googled this and apparently this is a very common malufunction with the camera- there's TONS of complaints about it. I tried all of the suggested efforts to fix it from the tech websites and nothing worked. I ended up having to use my cell phone for the remainder of the vacation to take pics.  Needless to say this piece of junk is going back. :(

Reviews.Title: Expected much better pictures
Reviews.Author: Barbara J. Gardner "Barb Gardner"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for hiking and canyoneering. So far I've not gotten a single great picture, and rarely any good ones. I've tried many settings and still have problems, especially in lower light conditions. I hiked Zion and Bryce for three days and I'm cursing my pictures. I may need to go back just to get some good pictures. I'm going back to Canon or Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and good price.
Reviews.Author: D. Mesas "Miami Mesa"
Reviews.Content: For being waterproof and shockproof, its a compact camera that fits easily into your pockets.  Nice looking shots and videos.  Buy it already, stop thinking about it.

Reviews.Title: D.O.A.
Reviews.Author: Canoeist
Reviews.Content: I bought this Fuji because of the cool case color and that it was touted as "shock proof".  Right out of the box the dang thing would not take pictures.  The menu screens all worked put you could not view the subject on the monitor.  After snapping a photo all that would appear was some wavy blue lines.  I loaded and reloaded the battery and memory just in case but still no view and no pics.  It will be going back to COSTCO tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: AMAZON GREAT, FUJI...NOT SO MUCH
Reviews.Author: BRUTUS
Reviews.Content: In July I bought this Fuji XP10 (green) for my wife as a gift. We took it to Norris Lake for vacation. On day one the cameras screen began to take on water as well as the view finder, once it dried out for the evening the battery would shut off when it wanted to...theres more...I also bought the Fuji accessory kit and an Olympus floating wristband. I used the Olympus for my Fuji and gave the other that came with the Fuji accessory kit to a friend to use. My friend that used the floating wristband from Fuji lost her Fuji when the tether came off of the floating part ..its at the bottom of Norris Lake near jump bridge.Applause Amazon ! They exchanged my camera and paid for shipping. Amazon is fantastic to deal with. This camera and accessories are my first purchase from Amazon but wont be the last.However, definetly the lase Fuji product, when I called Fuji to express my concerns I was made to feel as though I did something wrong. I was passed around to different people and landed on "D'S" voicemail. No response...2 weeks go by...I call again...then email...finally a response...then blah, blah, blah.AMAZON...I THANK YOU, FUJI...GOOD LUCK TO YOU.

Reviews.Title: cute at first but not a good cam for me
Reviews.Author: icy
Reviews.Content: i received it perfectly in good condition...i was so excited when we first used it in the beach without even sinking under water,, it was suddenly stopped working...only the video worked and i can't even do anything other than using the video.. i can't even go onto menus...i called amazon to inform them and in 2 days they sent a new replacement cam for me...it's working but i don't know til i use it again for real shooting...hope this time the camera will work very fine because i don't  wanna waste money for nothing and worthless...but i thankd amazon for the replacement...it was so fast..

Reviews.Title: Great choice for watery vacations
Reviews.Author: dephal
Reviews.Content: We took the Fuji xp10 to Hawaii for a week and the camera was great.  Perfect for taking pictures on the beach as waves and sea spray do not affect it.  We took pictures of the kids beachcombing, playing in the surf, and swimming in the ocean.  In addition, I took the camera snorkeling and was able to take  many pictures of the fish on the reef.  Even underwater you can hear the on beep.  Fits well in my hand and is very light.  Lots of settings allowed me to take great pictures of the sunsets every evening. The picture quality is very good overall.It does have a few downsides. The controls are not obvious and it can take some fiddling to figure things out. Uploading pictures to a compter via a USB cord is slightly awkward. And, although the camera itself is water and shock resistent, the large view screen ended up with a pretty good scratch when the camera met with some lava rocks.

Reviews.Title: Nice waterproof feature but otherwise MEDIOCRE point&shoot;
Reviews.Author: Phil
Reviews.Content: If you know anything about decent cameras you'll be constantly irritated by the grainy, often out of focus, and if you shoot in anything other than bright mid-day sun, blurry photos.  I have a 7 year old Fuji Finepix5000 that takes a MUCH better, clearer, sharper, and more vibrant photo than this camera, and it is only a 3.2mp.  The buttons are very difficult to push with anything but the tip of a fingernail.  I really dislike this camera.

Reviews.Title: rugged, pictures so-so, buttons tought to press
Reviews.Author: Jefe Noriega
Reviews.Content: The picture quality of this camera is not the greatest. Often, even with decent light, I have trouble getting a clear shot (perhaps it is my lack of steady hand though). The 720p video quality is decent for the price of this camera. As other reviews say, it is not extremely smooth. But hey, this isn't a camcorder! The camera does seem rugged, and overall I like the design. In my opinion, it is small and thin enough to carry wherever. I've used it underwater a couple of times without any problems.Overall, a decent camera for the price, but I'm not blown away.

Reviews.Title: Video audio is HORRIBLE!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Guerrero "Joe G."
Reviews.Content: My wife has been wanting a waterproof camera for a VERY long time. She had this camera on her wishlist so when I wanted to surprise her with a gift for our anniversary, I bought this for her. She was BEYOND excited when I gave it to her. The size is perfect! The built is nice too. It takes good pictures. She also wanted this Point and Shoot for taking videos really quick. So she could upload and share with family online. I know this is NOT specifically a digital camcorder but she owned a Nikon Point & Shoot before, which she mainly used to carry in her purse since her DSLR camera is just too big to carry around to some events. She wanted something small, easy and quick to use. The Nikon point and shoot she owned before took great videos too. She loved it.This camera however, takes video horribly! When she uploaded the video to the computer the audio was absolutely HORRIBLE. I don't know if I got one that had a defect or something but you couldn't even hear anything clearly. The audio was very VERY low. Very unrecognizable. It was BAD. I know she didn't want it mainly for the video feature but I figured at least the audio would be good. I didn't expect it to be THAT horrible. It was so bad that she asked me to return it.We didn't even get to use it in water. We were looking forward to using it when the pool opened up. So I don't know how it works underwater. But I wanted to make sure and write a review about the audio in the video feature because had I read that, I wouldn't have bought it for her. I would have bought something else.

Reviews.Title: We have enjoyed using this.
Reviews.Author: Wendy McFarland
Reviews.Content: It has worked really well.  We love the underwater shots.  You just have to take care of the camera properly which takes a little effort.  We have been very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Nice little unit
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I take this thing everywhere. It has been around the world and takes whatever punishment I deal out. Mountain climbing, snorkeling and anything in between, it holds up well. Takes a decent picture. Once in a while the auto settings can be frustrating... but most of the time it's a breeze.

Reviews.Title: Don't bother
Reviews.Author: Granitelake
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to take the place of buying disposable waterproof cameras for vacations - pools, lazy rivers, etc.  We bought in summer of 2011 and used it once. Pictures underwater turned out better than pics above water.  Stored it in the closet until this summer's vacation in Hawaii and it took in water in the pool on the first day - hasn't worked since. Our friends bought the Nikon Coolpix and it worked great in the water - he even went diving with it.

Reviews.Title: Don't believe advertising and Fuji
Reviews.Author: rmonta1
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the advertising. The camera did work well in water but the lens cracked when my daughter was bumped and camera dropped from hands. I witnessed the accident.It fell only 4-5ft and landed on a wooden floor. Fuji would not replace camera. They said they tested these cameras and they never cracked before. I bought this camera for this reason, as her last camera broke when dropped.Very disappointed in FUJI. I have bought the Olympus waterproof,shockproof camera in the past, will probably replace the fuji with Olympus. She only had this camera 3 months!! Would not recommend!!

Reviews.Title: You better plan to buy another camera when the warranty expires!
Reviews.Author: Swedee
Reviews.Content: I like all the features of the FinePix XP10, but it had to be returned for repair after six months, and it was only used underwater (in 3 feet) for two months.  All instructions were followed to the letter; the camera was never mis-used.  I am not confident of using it underwater when the warranty expires.

Reviews.Title: NOT WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: Jennie
Reviews.Content: Do not buy! We bought this camera to take on our honeymoon to Bermuda. Our first day there we went to a beach and tried the camera underwater for the first time. It stopped working after about five minutes in a foot or two of water. We got back to shore and opened the battery compartment and it was full of water. After about a day of drying out it would only turn on if you wedged something between the battery and the door to make the battery make better contact with the terminals, but the screen never came back to life. It took pictures but there was no way to change settings or see what you were taking pictures of.Quality of pictuers left something to be desired also, too bad you can't give negative stars.

Reviews.Title: Terrible camera
Reviews.Author: Chookoo
Reviews.Content: I took pictures with the XP10 in a variety of conditions and it only capable of a taking decent pictures in very bright light. If it's overcast or your indoors this camera takes terrible pictures. The pictures always came out blurry and had a lot of noise. The auto focus was very flaky even in bright light. I'd say 2 out of every 3 pictures had bad focus even in bright light.

Reviews.Title: Lasted less than 1 month
Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: I was in love with this camera, until our first trip to the beach when it broke. Most of the buttons quit working and we had to return it. Takes great pictures, and videos but didn't last long at all.

Reviews.Title: Okay for very still pictures
Reviews.Author: Sharon Comly "Sharon 204"
Reviews.Content: i bought this camera hoping for one that would take good, not necesarrily great pictures. I got it, and ir was awful. The pictures were all blury, and i tried all the settings. You can't see anything when it is underwater. I would not recomend this if you are trying for anything close to quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: It is okayyyyy....
Reviews.Author: KrissySYD
Reviews.Content: for the price I guess.As I am getting ready for an all-snorkelling-diving-water sports holiday I desperately wanted a waterproof camera at a modest price - this will do the job.However, I am not impressed by the battery design. If it is a waterproof camera surely the idea would be for users not to open the camera case too frequently...well the battery is the not helping this.This camera comes with a battery that you have to put into a charger docket and plug the charger to the wall socket. The charger docket will charge the battery which then you have to insert into its slot in the camera."tiny" design issue here is that this camera will be used by tourists a lot..there is only 1 charger docket supplied and it is a tiny piece of plasticy thing the first item a tourist will loose when on the road.Why not a USB cable or a cable of any kind to charge the battery which is locked in the camera case? Why all the hassle of opening the case, placing into a docket and charging it outside of the camera....I have also ordered the Fuji Kit for the flotable strap- it is supposed to be exchangeable to a normal strap. Not mine. However hard I try, I can not unplug the flotable strap to swap to the normal..But it is water and beachproof, takes decent photos underwater so despite I have to be on alert not to loose the battery charger docket it does the job - but definately not replacing my "normal" camera...

Reviews.Title: This camera has lots of issues
Reviews.Author: kdy
Reviews.Content: I wish I never purchased this camera. Let's go through the good, the bad, and the ugly.  THE GOOD 1) Size and weight - it is easily portable. 2)It does have some nice menu features that allow you to adjust the camera to take pictures in various environments such as text, portraits, panoramic, etc. 3)It's easy to use.  THE BAD 1) Shutter speed is super slow, 2) Camera takes a long time to focus, 3) There is a very long pause between shots.  THE UGLY 1)The pictures are horrible - no matter which setting you use.  2) Not one shot is every in good focus 3) Camera stinks at taking shots indoors - even with decent lighting. 4) It's great that you can take this underwater but the casing leads to various problems - condensation buildings on the plexi glass that covers the lens so some pictures look cloudy or have what appears to have bubbles on them.  This casing makes it difficult for the lens to focus on anything.  I would say that 1 out of every 25 or so pictures turns out "pretty good."  If you choose to buy this camera, play around with it immediately to see for yourself so that you have time to return it.  There are a lot of other great cameras out there that have similar features and still take GREAT pictures. Casio has a neat little one that is worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: jen
Reviews.Content: So far it is a great camera.  I have only had it a short time so we will see how it endures, but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Esta camara esta brutal!!!
Reviews.Author: Vilma
Reviews.Content: Compre esta camara por unas vacaciones en Cancun, y despues de verificar un monton de recomendaciones me decidi por esta camara y no me arrepiento en los 8 dias que estuve de vacaciones casi todas mis actividades fueron acuaticas y la camara nunca fallo de verdad que la recomiendo no se van arrepentir. Yo le habia comprado a mi hija una olympus stylus tough y no salio tan buena como esta, esta resistio mas es una excelente camara por el precio y si pueden comprar el kit mucho mejor.

Reviews.Title: screen died after 3 months use
Reviews.Author: bjacobsc
Reviews.Content: This camera has been nothing but problems since I ordered it. Now the screen's died completely; the thing takes pictures, but if you can't see what you're looking at, there's not much to do. Now fujifilm wants ME to pay for shipping to send it in to their repairmen. Absolute crap.[Updated 2 June 2011]: Sent the camera back to Fujifilm, which they "fixed", then managed to get a friend to bring it down to Costa Rica for me, where, WITHIN 2 WEEKS!!!! it broke again. THIS IS NOT A CAMERA YOU WANT. trust me.

Reviews.Title: la peor camara !!!!
Reviews.Author: Eleazar Figallo
Reviews.Content: Primero que nada, no es una camara waterproof, en el segundo viaje que la use  se daño la pantalla  y el arreglo me sale igual que comprarme otro asi que..... no les recomiendo para nada este producto, hay camaras muchisimo mejores que esta.saludos

Reviews.Title: First time Fugi...not impressed
Reviews.Author: HNB
Reviews.Content: I live a very active lifestyle and have a tendency to break cameras, so I was very excited to hear that someone created a camera that would seem to stand up to the great outdoors. I have always owned Olympus so I was a little tentative in diving into a new brand. Let's just say that I should have stuck to my gut feeling. Some pictures turn out great while the majority of them seem to come out blurry (it's not just action shots...portraits seem to be the worst! and yes, I have tried all of the settings). Also, every time I remove the battery to charge, after replacing it in the camera, it's a crap shoot as to whether it will turn on. I think I would have been happier with the risk of breaking another Olympus...at least I would get the quality and consistency that I expect (until it takes a tumble off of a cliff and into the river).

Reviews.Title: camera Broke after less than 4 months
Reviews.Author: BR
Reviews.Content: I was really happy to get this camera, specially for the features offered. It took really good pictures until it just broke out of the blue. When I got back from vacations and tried to save my pictures, the camera just desplayed an error message... Two really bad things: I had just bought the camera 4 months earlier and the Amazon partner seller "Retired and Loving Life" didn't offer a written warranty... I had to send it to Fuji and are still waiting for an answer

Reviews.Title: Fujifile FinePix XP10 12MP
Reviews.Author: farmgirl
Reviews.Content: We had the older version of this camera, and took it EVERYWHERE!  However, we ran it over and decided go with this model, and we absolutely LOVE IT!! I would recommend it to anyone that likes the outdoors, you don't have to worry about water, dust, etc.  It is perfect!

Reviews.Title: I like it a lot
Reviews.Author: A. Nasri
Reviews.Content: For the price range, this camera packs a lot of tech.  I'm having fun using all it's features like face detection and the "couple timer."  Took me less than an hour to get the hang of using it, very intuitive design.  Picture quality is good under all conditions.  This is my  first waterproof camera and I can't wait to take it to the beach!

Reviews.Title: Not a good buy
Reviews.Author: mjhey
Reviews.Content: I had ordered this a few months ago an quickly learned that when you took a video, it had horrible sound quality. You could also not take a picture without flash indoors, or else it would blur uncontrollably. There is no digital image stabilization that I saw of. Furthermore, about 2 months after I bought it, the finish started wearing off. The waterproof finish off the right side. It's in the mail right now, getting it's way back to Fuji. Sometimes it wouldn't even load pictures onto the computer. It's very pretty and compact, convenient to carry as well, but overall, not a good camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it was exactly what I was looking for and the reviews were correct.  I would definitely recommend this camera to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Arthur Kicker "Ragged, Tagged, and Bodybagged"
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  I love the size of it.  Its got a good weight to it, not too light, not too heavy. The picture quality great, very clear, nice pictures.  I've never owned a Fuji product before but this camera seems very well made and sturdy.  I've just recently gotten it so I've yet to delve into all the features.  But it is easy to use, a typical point and click type camera.  We took it on a boating trip and it worked wonderfully.  I didn't dip it in the ocean or anything, but a little water was splashed around and the camera held up nicely.  For the price, I'd recommend it.  A great little camera for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Don't make the same mistake as I did!
Reviews.Author: Angela M Serio
Reviews.Content: I will never purchase a Fuji camera ever again, based on my experience with this camera.  Fuji claims that the camera is "best for any WILD" activities, boasting the fact that it is waterproof up to 3 m underwater, shockproof up to 3.3 feet tall, and freezeproof up to 14 degrees F.  This is quite frankly, untruthful advertising.  Note that I have had this camera for less than 1 year and never done any of the "WILD" activities noted above, yet the camera completely stopped working.  Yes, it got scratched up from wear and tear, but it was never submerged in water, dropped at 3.3 feet height, or exposed to subzero temperatures.  The camera's rubber buttons immediately started peeling within 1 month of purchasing the camera and the camera completely stopped taking photos after just 6 months of use.  On top of all that, it takes crappy pictures.When I attempted to get Fuji film to stand behind their guarantee and 1 year warrantee, they claimed that none of the "damage" was covered under warranty and that I'd have to pay roughly the cost of the camera to have it fixed.Please don't make the same mistake as I did by purchasing this piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: Best little camera ever
Reviews.Author: Theresa A. Hoover
Reviews.Content: I have owned a digital camera since they came onto the market. This is the easiest and best quality picture taker I have ever used.  5 of my friends have bought the same camera and they also love, love, love it.  This is a must have camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera for 100$
Reviews.Author: Yevgeny
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after my old one ( Pentax) was stealed. Not succeed to receive the quality like it was in old Pentax camera. Special problems in Auto Mode pictures in Room with Flush without day light

Reviews.Title: very happy
Reviews.Author: Wayne Lavasseur
Reviews.Content: I only gave it four stars becauce i have not use the movie part yet .Today i used it underwater for the first time and i am very happy with it.I bought it becauce we are going to sequoia national park and i needed a camera that will not get ruin. I live IN death valley where it is  very windy and dusty so far works very good.

Reviews.Title: bad product never worked
Reviews.Author: Ac
Reviews.Content: This was the worst product i bought from amazon. It arrived early which was the only good thing about it. I followed all the instructions in the manual, charged the battery and the camera could not even turn on. I was so bitterly disappointed i wanted to smash it, but sense cane to mind.I bought it for a function and could not use it. I have since returned it and awaiting my refund. Bad experience!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy - unreliable
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Hermanns
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for a 3week offshore trip - worked day one then never turned on again. Thanks Fuji for ruining my trip and not allowing me to share the experience with friends and family. Biggest pile of electronics junk I've purchased in 10 yrs.Before it broke (after 24 hrs) I tested 2 videos and you could hear the loud groaning of the optical zoom as it tried to constantly focus.I'm livid at Fuji for building such a unreliable camera - Shame on them!

Reviews.Title: People whoe write reviews
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: After searching many websites.... I realized people who leave messages here, hate fuji... and do not own this camera...beware!

Reviews.Title: The never ending delivery nightmare
Reviews.Author: Alan
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera through amazon.com with second day shipping because I was leaving the country in a week. They told me of a delay in shipping but I could still deal with the new date. I was already wishing I had bought it locally but I couldn't cancel due to it being "prepared for shipping". Then another delay notification this time five days after my departure date. Still can't cancel as it is being "prepared for shipping." It looks like I will have to hassle with them over the creditcard billing. I am going out now to buy one locally. I trust the camera itself will be suitable.

Reviews.Title: Very Incovenient Charging
Reviews.Author: Hari Tadepalli "refractory reflector"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera at local Costco. It looked sleek, stylish and sportsy. But, when it came to charging the battery after opening the box, I got baffled. This camera does not have a charging port - period. Every time you need to charge the battery, you have to pry open the battery from the camera, insert it in a stand alone charger and then insert it back into the camera.Ease of use and readiness on the moment are why people go for low profie digital cameras. If this were a cordless drill, this mode of swapping battery is acceptable. Not for a pocket camera, considering every camera in its class has a built in charge port and many come with a docking station.Result - I plan to return it to Costco right today, a day after I bought it.

Reviews.Title: waste of paying for next day shipping
Reviews.Author: Anthony Hahn
Reviews.Content: camera is very impressive.However paid for next day shipping, did not arrive as promissed, Amazon offered no compensation.Purchase turned out to be useless because of failed shipping.

ProductInfo.Features:
Movie Editing Mode and Blog mode; Facebook/YouTube Automatic Web Upload function for photos
Capture movies in 720p with sound
Four-Way protection: waterproof, freezeproof, shockproof and dustproof
12-megapixel resolution for large, photo-quality prints
Fujinon 5x periscopic optical zoom lens with reinforced protective lens barrier
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix XP10 12 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 5x Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue)
